title: Summer Day Camp Counselor
description:
**OVERVIEW**

Kids Great Minds is hiring **camp counselor staff** for summer 2025\\. We provide a fun computer learning experience that is non\\-traditional and built specifically for children, teens and their learning style.

Kids Great Minds counselors have a unique blend of professionalism and some experience with children. They also have a genuine desire to work with children and teens, while being flexible, patient, energetic, tolerant and ready to have fun!! Our counselors will work closely with the lead instructors, along with other camp staff.

**CORE DUTIES**

* Work directly with the Head Instructor.
* Aid students in groups or one\\-on\\-one with any questions they may have.
* Take part in **staff meetings (online or in person)**, to occur before and/or after camp on a designated day
* Take part in **team building** activities.
* Lead games and activities during break times
* **Engage with students** during breaks and lunch to ensure they are safe and having fun.
* Assist with classroom setup and turnover.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

Experience with children or camp settings is an asset. Knowledge in computer software is not necessary; however, the ideal candidate for this job will have basic knowledge and/or the ability to quickly learn new software, or languages in one of the following categories: **Game Design and Development, 3D Modeling \\& Design, Animation, Programming, Robotics \\& App Development.**

NOTE: Kids Great Minds will provide intensive training prior to camp

**PRE\\-COURSE TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION**

Obtain CPR\\-C Certification at least seven days prior to the start of camp. Kids Great Minds is not responsible for the fees or scheduling.

Complete all online and onsite trainings.

Complete all contracts, hiring packets, and police background check prior to start date.

**JOB LOCATIONS**

Kids Great Minds works in partnership with municipalities all across the GTA to provide computer courses in local libraries and community centres. You will be assigned teaching locations based on where you live. We teach courses throughout **York, Durham and Simcoe.** We are looking to hire a few candidates from each region**. A driver’s license and access to a vehicle for the summer is an asset.**

**TO APPLY**

Submit your cover letter and resume to jobs@kidsgreatminds.org. Only successful candidates will be contacted, but we thank everyone for their interest.

Job Types: Full\\-time, Seasonal  
Contract length: 9 weeks

Pay: $17\\.20\\-$19\\.00 per hour

Flexible language requirement:

* French not required

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* On call

Ability to commute/relocate:

* GTA, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

* summer camp: 1 year (preferred)

Work Location: In person

Application deadline: 2025\\-04\\-30  
Expected start date: 2025\\-06\\-23

title: Consultant (Implementation)
description:
**The Opportunity**

  

This position is for a **Consultant** at Euna Budget, implementing and supporting the Euna Budget Enterprise product. In this role, you will be providing customer support to clients, supporting implementation teams, and supporting software configuration of the solution Budget Formulation and Management (BFM), application testing, and documentation. Euna Budget Enterprise is a public sector budgeting software. As such, familiarity with public sector budgeting or other public sector work experience is very helpful – but not necessarily required. We are a tightknit group of professionals that enjoy helping clients, creative problem solving, are lifelong learners, and enjoy new challenges. If this sounds like you, please consider applying.

  



Experience:


* Public sector budgeting or accounting experience
* Proficiency with Microsoft tools such as Word and Excel
* Strong writing skills
* Project management experience or certification
* Ability to work independently and remotely
* Unwavering commitment to clients and team members
* Experience with managing multiple tasks simultaneously
* Experience with software configuration


It may be beneficial to have...


* Worked with public sector budgeting software
* Understand databases and data models
* SQL experience


Job Duties (may include):


* Respond to client inquiries and help desk requests
* Participate in client discovery sessions as part of an implementation team
* Provide support to other implementation consultants on the team
* Design and configure our software solution \\-Budget Formulation and Management (BFM)
* Create documentation for BFM including Word, PowerPoint and Video training
* Provide client training
* BFM testing
* Report testing
* Publishing testing
* Self\\-study of required technologies to gain required competence, not limited to BFM and SQL
* Travel as needed to client sites based on engagements. Estimated travel is 0\\-4 trips per year.
* Track hours and activities to allow for appropriate reporting

Other duties as assigned  
* 

  

**Location \\& Travel:**



This position will be hybrid with 3 days/week in our Oakville, ON office. Travel as needed to client sites based on engagements. Estimated travel is 0\\-4 trips per year.

 **What It's Like to Work at Euna Solutions**

  

At Euna Solutions, we carefully foster a work environment where employees have a safe space for creative and intellectual freedom, and the opportunity to work cross\\-functionally. We offer a dynamic environment with considerable opportunity for professional growth and advancement.

  

Here are some of the perks that Euna employees enjoy:



 Competitive wages  

We pay competitive wages and salaries, and we only expect an honest 40\\-hour week for it.


* ️ Wellness days


What’s better than a long weekend? An extra\\-long weekend! Euna Employees enjoy 2 extra days off in the summer to extend long weekends! Extra days to decompress and spend time doing the things you love.

 Community Engagement Committee  

At Euna, we know how important it is to give back. Our community engagement committee looks for ways to give back to our local communities through time, gifts and skills.



Flexible work days  

We understand that what a workday looks like differs by employee and the role requirements. Through our interview process we’ll work with you to ensure it’s a fit for you and the specific role you’re interested in.



 Benefits  

Ask us for a copy of our health and dental benefits!



 Culture committee  

Celebrate at every occasion with the culture team! They make sure that our team’s culture is bustling with frequent fun events for holidays and special occasions, as well as for miscellaneous fun.

  

**About Euna Solutions**

  


Euna Solutions® is a leading provider of purpose\\-built, cloud\\-based solutions that power critical administrative functions and financial operations for the public sector. Euna Solutions offers trusted, easy\\-to\\-use solutions for procurement, payments, grant management, budgeting, permitting, and special education administration that are trusted to increase operational efficiency, transparency, collaboration, and compliance. Working with more than 3,000 government and public sector organizations across North America, Euna Solutions strives to build trust and enable transparency in our communities. Euna Solutions is recognized on Government Technology’s GovTech 100 list, an annual list of the top 100 companies focused on, making a difference in and selling to state and local government agencies across the U.S. To learn more, visit www.eunasolutions.com.

  

Please visit our website: https://eunasolutions.com/careers/and check out our LinkedIn Pages https://www.linkedin.com/company/eunasolutions/

  

We believe in embracing new perspectives and optimizing If you have relatable experience and relevant transferrable skills but feel you may be missing a few of the requirements, we encourage you to apply! We recognize that people have unique career journeys and if you're excited about this role and know you can bring something great to the team, then we want to hear from you. Please know Euna Solutions is committed to providing a comfortable and accessible interview process for every candidate. If there are any accommodations our team can make throughout our hiring process (big or small), please let us know.

  

  

*For any inquiries or requests regarding accessibility at Euna Solutions, please email* *recruiting@eunasolutions.com* *or call our office at 1\\.877\\.707\\.7755\\. Upon request, appropriate accessible formats or arrangements will be provided as soon as practicable.*

title: Meter Technician Coop
description:
**About Us:**  

  

At Rodan Energy, our mission is Making Sustainable, Attainable. As a leading North American energy services company, we provide innovative energy solutions that help clients reduce energy costs and GHG emissions, support electrification, and enhance grid efficiency. With over 20 years of expertise, we’re trusted by North America’s largest energy users, power producers, and utilities.  

  

**Why Join Rodan:*** **Thriving Industry**: Join a rapidly growing sector at the forefront of innovation and sustainability, shaping the future of energy management.
* **Product Market Fit**: With a 98% client retention rate and consistent YOY growth, Rodan has built a reputation for delivering trusted, long\\-term partnerships with industry leaders.
* **Top Talent \\& Strong Culture**: Collaborate with high\\-performing, passionate individuals who are committed to excellence and sustainability.

**What Makes This Role Great:*** This is a great opportunity for a co\\-op student who enjoys hands\\-on technical work and wants to gain real\\-world experience in the energy sector. As a Meter Technician Summer co\\-op, you’ll be involved in the installation and maintenance of metering and energy management systems, playing a key role in supporting essential field operations. This role is ideal for students with MEARIE or similar training who are based in the GTA and open to travel within the region—and occasionally across Ontario. You’ll gain practical experience, work alongside experienced technicians, and develop valuable skills in electrical systems, field service, and energy management—making it a strong stepping stone for a future career in the industry.

**Key Responsibilities:*** Provide technical services in the areas of electrical systems, metering, power systems and energy management services
* Install, test, and commission retail and wholesale metering systems
* Complete all types of maintenance work on retail and wholesale metering installations
* Able to manage projects with minimal supervision to completion
* Perform design, configuration, installation, and on\\-site configuration and maintenance of metering, SCADA and energy management systems, including hardware, software, communications and end\\-user training
* Enforce safe work procedures are followed at all times
* Maintain client communications, safety and work documentation
* Ensure Rodan meets compliance and reporting requirements of federal, provincial and local regulations

  

**Required Skills and Qualifications:*** Post\\-secondary education in a related technical field (e.g. electrical engineering, electrical technician/technologist) or other relevant work experience
* Completed or working towards Journeyperson Meter Technician Certification or equivalent
* Background in electrical power distribution, metering, protection and control or electrical systems
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and effectively complete tasks
* Strong attention to detail
* Demonstrated time management skills
* Proven ability to develop and maintain relationships with internal and external clients
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills
* Ability to work independently as well as a member of a team
* A valid Class ‘G’ Ontario Driver’s License, driver’s insurance and an excellent driving record
* Knowledge of and experience with computer software such as Microsoft Office
* First Aid \\& CPR certificates and knowledge of EUSA and the OHSA are assets

**Apply Now:** If you’re passionate about innovation and driving growth in a rapidly evolving industry, we want to hear from you!  

  

Rodan Energy Website \\| Twitter \\| LinkedIn  

  

***Please note that a criminal background check will be conducted as part of our hiring process***

title: In-Person English Teacher - OCT Required (Winter 2025 Semester)
description:
Master Choice Learning is looking for an enthusiastic and reliable English teacher who enjoys working with students from K\\-G8\\.

This is a part\\-time position with a mix of either in\\-person and virtual classes. The ideal candidate would need to be flexible on weekends and a minimum of 2 weekdays. Hours vary from 5\\-10 hours on a weekly basis for each teacher, schedules are confirmed per Semester (Fall, Winter, Summer).

You can find additional details on our website at masterchoicelearning.com. We accept applications through the Indeed application portal or directly to our corporate email: masterchoicelearning@gmail.com

In\\-person classes will be held at our physical location. **(L3R 1J5, Markham, ON)**

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Encourage high standards in student progress and level of understanding in English;
* Support and motivate students to challenge themselves as learners;
* Teach individual students in one\\-on\\-one settings and in small group;
* Customize teaching methods to meet the learning styles of students;
* Complete learning summary after each session for students to critical reflect on lesson taught;
* Create individualized, curriculum\\-based teaching plans for each student based on his or her assessment.
* Deliver lessons with the aim of achieving the objectives of our institution.

**Qualifications:**

* 5\\+ years of experiences Teaching English under the Ontario Curriculum.
* Eligibility to work in Canada.
* OCT (Ontario Certified Teacher) certification required.
* Outstanding communication skills and personality. Have the ability to lead an engaging classes in a online and in\\-person setting.

**What’s in it for you?**

* Vacation and Holiday Pay.
* Reliable and strong course coordination team.
* After school and flexible hours during the week.
* Invested support to all teachers with paid resources and yearly accesses.

Job Types: Part\\-time, Casual

Pay: $28\\.00\\-$35\\.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Work from home

Flexible language requirement:

* French not required

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Unionville, ON L3R 5T5: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

* OCT (preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: HR Business Partner - 13 month Contract - Hybrid
description:
**ARE YOU INTERESTED IN A WORKPLACE THAT HAS...** **Summer Hours**Start your weekend earlier during the summer months!**Paid Days Off (in addition to Personal Days)**This includes an extra day off during the month of your birthday \\- our gift to you!**An IDEAS (Inclusion, Diversity, Equity, Awareness, Solidarity) team ️**
Weather is inclusive, we will be too. Our IDEAS team is committed to making this happen! **HAVE WE GOT YOUR ATTENTION? WANT TO LEARN MORE?**  

Read about us here! (spoiler alert… we are the home of The Weather Network )**Canada’s \\#1 most trusted brand** in media for the **third year** in a row! **WHY WE NEED YOU? GLAD YOU ASKED...**  

We are seeking an experienced and dynamic HR Business Partner to join our team, responsible for driving strategic HR initiatives that align with our business objectives. This role will involve close collaboration with leadership to develop and implement HR strategies tailored to enhance organizational growth and employee engagement. You will be looked upon as a trusted advisor on employee relations, change management, and workforce planning, ensuring a supportive work environment that fosters open communication and continuous improvement. If you are collaborative, have excellent communication skills, are passionate about creating an amazing employee experience and you thrive in a fast paced, evolving environment, well then this role is for you! ***Please note, this is a 13 Month Contract.*** ***While this job provides the flexibility to work from home the majority of the time, it requires travel to our office at Oakville 1\\-2 time per month and on requirement basis as well.******Please note we are only considering candidates who are eligible to work in Canada and are currently located in the Greater Toronto Area.***
### **WHAT IS THE DAY TO DAY LOOK LIKE**

* **Strategic HR Management and Business Understanding:** Partner with leaders to develop and implement HR strategies that align with and support business goals. Dive deep into your business units to gain a thorough understanding of their core objectives and key people priorities. Provide strategic input on organizational development and future workforce planning.
* **Employee Relations:** Serve as the primary point of contact for employees and managers, addressing concerns and resolving conflicts promptly while maintaining a human\\-centered approach. Ensure all employee relations activities comply with Federal labor laws and internal company policies. Your role will involve conducting thorough investigations when necessary, offering guidance on best practices, and promoting a culture of open communication and trust within the organization.
* **Change Management:** Lead and support organizational change initiatives, including restructuring efforts, to ensure smooth transitions and minimize disruptions. Collaborate with leaders to develop and implement change management plans aligned with business objectives.
* **Relationship Building:** Cultivate and maintain strong, trusting relationships with employees, managers, and key stakeholders within your Business Unit. This involves actively engaging with team members at all levels to understand their needs, concerns, and aspirations to enhance employee satisfaction and ensure alignment between HR initiatives and business goals.
* **Continuous Improvement:** Proactively recommend strategies to enhance and evolve the employee experience. Your role will involve identifying opportunities for improvement, analyzing data to inform decisions, and implementing initiatives that foster a positive and productive work environment.
* **Leave of Absence Management:** Oversee and manage leaves of absence, with a primary focus on maternity and parental leave. Ensure all required paperwork is accurately completed and filed in a timely manner, maintaining compliance with legal requirements and company policies. Facilitate a smooth transition for employees before, during, and after their leave to promote a positive experience.
* **Feedback Collection:** Conduct a variety of interviews and focus groups, including exit interviews, stay interviews, and new hire interviews, to gather valuable insights from employees at different stages of their employment. Use this data to make informed recommendations to senior management, contributing to the development of strategies and initiatives that drive employee engagement, retention, and overall organizational effectiveness.
* **HR Analytics and Reporting:** Leverage HR metrics and data to inform decision\\-making and evaluate the effectiveness of HR initiatives. Prepare and present detailed data reports, analyzing trends and providing actionable recommendations.
* **Compliance and Legislation:** Ensure compliance with labour laws and company policies. This includes staying up to date with any changes in employment legislation and industry best practices, and then sharing them back with the team to help us make any necessary updates or changes. Experience working with and applying the Canada Labour Code is considered a strong asset. Any experience working with US labour laws would be an added bonus!

 *Roles, responsibilities and duties may evolve and change over time.*### **WE ARE HOPING YOU HAVE**

* Undergraduate degree or Diploma/Certificate in Human Resources (preferred).
* 2\\-3 Years of People Ops Generalist or HR Business Partner Experience
* Demonstrated knowledge of the HR field, including an understanding of federal and provincial employment regulations, with specific experience in Federal Labour Law
* Demonstrated knowledge of handling sensitive employee relation situations including terminations and leave of absence.
* Highly organized and detail\\-oriented, with the ability to handle simultaneous projects with multiple moving parts.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; fearless in asking questions and pushing back when needed.
* Pro at prioritizing and thriving in a fast\\-paced, demanding environment.

### **YOU ARE MADE FOR THIS IF YOU...**

* Passion for creating highly memorable, second\\-to\\-none employee experiences.
* Sense of urgency; ability to move fast while keeping everyone looped in and paying attention to important details.
* Comfortable with change, ambiguity, and experimenting. We have big goals but don’t have everything figured out yet.
* Collaborative team player with a positive attitude.
* Tech\\-curious and data\\-driven decision maker

 **DON’T MEET ALL THE REQUIREMENTS? DON’T WORRY…***Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Pelmorex values and welcomes diverse experiences. While having “desired” qualifications makes for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Pelmorex. We are always looking for people who will be a* ***culture add*** *(yup, that's right, we don’t subscribe to culture fit, we want you to add to what we think is an amazing culture and work environment*### **INTERESTED? IT GETS BETTER…**

* Open and transparent communication, including All Hands Meetings with our CEO
* While we encourage 1:1 conversations, we recognize that not everyone is comfortable with speaking up. We have an anonymous reporting platform (Speakfully) to ensure everyone’s voice is heard\\\\uD83D\\\\uDDE3
* Frequent employee pulse surveys \\\\uD83D\\\\uDCDD we value your feedback so we can continue to make Pelmorex a great place to work!

**OUR PROMISE TO YOU...**  

We’re highly focused on doing the right thing.
We’ll discuss issues and timelines professionally, so you have the time you need to do the best work you can
You will see the result of your work pushed out to real users quickly
We’re a team that enjoys learning new technologies and we’re open to trying new things
We’ll try our best not to bog you down with boring meetings  

Weather inspires, protects, and transforms. For 35\\+ years, Pelmorex has led the way with trusted forecasts and alerts. With innovation at our core, we provide precision, speed, and unmatched reliability—safeguarding lives, powering decisions, and driving business success. Whatever the weather, we turn its potential into action. We’re Pelmorex. Imagine it and we’ll deliver it.

title: Pharmacist Student
description:
**Company Bio**

*Southlake is building healthy communities through outstanding care, innovative partnerships, and amazing people. We deliver a wide range of healthcare services to the communities of northern York Region and southern Simcoe County. Our advanced regional programs include Cancer Care and Cardiac Care and serve a broader population across the northern GTA and into Simcoe\\-Muskoka.*

*Our team of nearly 6,000 staff, physicians, volunteers, students and Patient and Family Advisors are committed to creating an environment where the best experiences happen. As a recognition of our commitment to quality and patient safety, we have received the highest distinction of Exemplary Standing from Accreditation Canada.*

**Job Summary**


The Pharmacy Student is employed between May and August and then works casual part\\-time shifts through the school year. The Pharmacy Student will be collecting the best possible medication histories. (Note: EPE placements will be facilitated with a preceptor)

**Qualifications**

* Enrolment in a Pharmacist Degree Program University Level; minimum 2nd year.
* Demonstrated computer knowledge/skills and keyboarding skills
* Demonstrated interpersonal skills: communication, teamwork
* Demonstrated knowledge of pharmaceutical arithmetic, pharmaceutical terminology
* Regular attendance is a requirement of the position, in particular in the summer months of June, July and August.
* Working in the Emergency Department and other patient units, gathering medication histories
* Demonstrated excellence in communication, both written and verbal
* Demonstrated problem assessment skills
* Demonstrated commitment to customer service and teamwork
* Demonstrated individual leadership skills

**Closing Statement**

***Regular and reliable attendance is an expected requirement of this position.***


At Southlake, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live and serve, including those with disabilities. Southlake is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.


It is the responsibility of all Southlake employees to work in a safe manner and promote health and safety in the workplace.

title: IT Summer Student
description:
**Summer Student Opportunity:** Full\\-time Fixed Contract
  
**Dates:** Early June to late August
  
**Location:** Bolton ON office
  
  

Are you about to finish your first year of an Information Technology program and eager to apply what you’ve learned in a real\\-world setting? This summer position offers you the chance to work on diverse projects, gain hands\\-on
  
experience, and learn from seasoned professionals who are here to support your growth. If you’re passionate about technology, enjoy solving problems, and are ready to contribute to a dynamic team, this role is for you.
  
  

What You'll Be Doing
  
  

**In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to:**  

* Triage and assist with Helpdesk tickets, providing timely follow\\-ups and solutions to users.
* Manage the lifecycle of IT equipment, including setting up and shipping Toshiba replacement laptops
* Organize and maintain the IT storage room to ensure efficiency.
* Set up new laptops, phones, and iPads, ensuring users can hit the ground running.
* Prepare outdated devices for recycling in a responsible manner.
* Review and validate documentation and knowledgebases as part of a system transition project.


This is a fantastic opportunity to explore different aspects of IT operations while making a meaningful impact.
  
  

What We’re Looking For
  
  

**We’re looking for a motivated student with:**  

* An interest in working with hardware
* A solid foundation in Windows, Active Directory, and networking fundamentals.
* Strong troubleshooting and problem\\-solving skills.
* Excellent communication skills and a commitment to customer service.
* The ability to juggle multiple tasks and stay organized in a fast\\-paced environment.
* A passion for technology and learning.
* Bonus points for experience with ticketing systems and certifications like CompTIA A\\+, ITIL, or Microsoft certifications—but these aren’t mandatory.


What’s In It For You
  
We’re committed to making this summer opportunity as rewarding as possible, offering:
  
* A collaborative and supportive environment where you’ll work alongside experienced mentors.
* Practical, hands\\-on experience with a variety of IT systems and tasks.
* Opportunities for learning and professional development that prepare you for your career.
* The chance to work with innovative technology in a dynamic industry.


If you’re ready to dive into a meaningful summer experience, grow your skills, and work on projects that make a difference, we encourage you to apply!

title: Marketing and Communications Coordinator
description:
**Position:** Marketing and Communications Coordinator

**Contract Length:** 8 weeks starting April 21st. The candidate must be available June 6\\-8\\.

**Salary/Hours:** $17\\.20/hr for 35 hours/week \\- with ability to work evenings and weekends.

**Location:** Hybrid (70% In\\-person in the Willowdale community and 30% Virtual).

Are you a creative looking to put your marketing and storytelling skills to work for real community impact? NeighbourLink North York is on the lookout for a dynamic Marketing \\& Communications Coordinator to join our team for a fast\\-paced, hands\\-on 8\\-week contract. If you're a strategic communicator, love social media, and thrive in a collaborative and compassionate environment, this is the opportunity for you.

**Position Summary:** Reporting to the Marketing and Events Manager, the Marketing and Communications Coordinator is responsible for coordinating and implementing the organization's internal and external communication initiatives to various stakeholders and audiences including; neighbours, volunteers, small businesses, churches and agencies.

The successful candidate will have superb written and verbal communication skills. The candidate will create promotional materials and presentations, write newsletters and develop content for our website and social media to effectively deliver NeighbourLink’s message to our stakeholders.

**Details:** The Marketing and Communications Coordinator will be primarily responsible for:

**Marketing and Communications (40%)** 

* Developing marketing campaigns for NeighbourLink’s programs and events, ensuring uniformity of branding in content/messaging.
* Preparing key organization communications content, including the annual report, fact sheets, brochures, news releases and posters.
* Writing and editing email newsletters using Mailchimp, following timelines.
* Designing and editing graphics for print or web as needed.
* Creating events on Zeffy and sending out all necessary communications to participants.

**Social Media and Website Management (30%)** 

* Developing new, relevant, and meaningful content on Canva to post on our social media through Hootsuite regularly. This includes writing copy, taking photos, and creating graphics.
* Attending NeighbourLink’s various programs and events in person to capture photos and videos and post live to our stories
* Generating original content based on trends to create reels, then executing those ideas.
* Regularly reviewing and updating content on our website www.neighbourlink.org using Wix.
* Tracking Social Media Data and Analytics

**Events and Administration (30%)** 

* Coordinating meeting schedules, agendas, action and follow\\-up items.
* Emailing businesses for partnership and sponsorship opportunities.
* Ensure Marketing and Communications folders and contacts are up\\-to\\-date.
* Coordinating events alongside the Marketing and Events Manager.

**Qualifications:**

* A bachelor's degree or diploma in communications, marketing or equivalent work experience.
* Demonstrated ability to write strategic communication pieces for an organization, including press releases, newsletters, website content, social media copy, etc.
* Superb organizational, project and time management, problem\\-solving and analytical skills
* Excellent attention to detail; strong written and verbal communication, graphic design, interpersonal, research, and analytical skills.
* Proficiency in applications including Google Suite, Wix, Canva, Mailchimp, Hootsuite, Bitly, Linktree, TikTok, etc. and or willingness to learn
* Energetic, friendly and respectful demeanor.
* Enjoys engaging people through social media, which includes Facebook, Instagram and TikTok
* Strong public speaking and presentation skills.
* Able to multitask and demonstrate flexibility in taking on new tasks as they arise.
* Ability to work well independently while contributing to a team environment.

**About Us:** NeighbourLink North York is a Christian community development organization located in Willowdale, North York. Our mission is to engage and empower neighbours to care for each other in practical, relational and sustainable ways that give everyone the opportunity to live out their potential. We believe transformation happens when we work together as neighbours to address the gaps and needs around us, including poverty and social isolation. As a Christian organization, we have spiritual practices, including silence, contemplation, and prayer are a part of our meetings. We do not require our employees to be of Christian faith, but we ask applicants to be respectful of these practices and invite them to participate according to their level of comfort.

**This position is open until filled**

To apply for this exciting opportunity to work with an incredible team, please send your resume to: hiring@neighbourlink.org and include “**Marketing and Communications Coordinator**” and your name in the subject line. Neighbourlink North York is committed to fostering a respectful and inclusive environment. As we are currently working in a hyper\\-local capacity, **preference will be given to people who reside in Willowdale**. This job will require Vulnerable Sector Screening or a Police Check due to the nature of our programming. While we thank all applicants for their interest, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Please note this position is funded by Canada Summer Jobs and the candidate must meet all the requirements per the program which can be found at https://www.canada.ca/en/employment\\-social\\-development/services/funding/canada\\-summer\\-jobs/who\\-can\\-apply.html\\#h3\\.3

Job Type: Fixed term contract  
Contract length: 8 weeks

Pay: $17\\.20 per hour

Expected hours: 17\\.20 per week

Schedule:

* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application question(s):

* Are you located in Willowdale?
* Are you located in North York
* Please confirm that you are aware of and meet all the requirements for Canada Summer Jobs https://www.canada.ca/en/employment\\-social\\-development/services/funding/canada\\-summer\\-jobs/who\\-can\\-apply.html\\#h3\\.3

Work Location: Hybrid remote in North York, ON M2M 2L7

Application deadline: 2025\\-04\\-16  
Expected start date: 2025\\-04\\-21

title: Cleaner - Permanent Full Time
description:
Realstar is a fully integrated management firm providing a full range of investment and property management services for the last 50 years. It is one of Canada’s largest multi\\-residential asset managers on behalf of institutional and private investors. It manages over 22,000 rental apartments in six provinces with an asset value of more than $5 billion. Realstar is headquartered in Toronto, and is part of Realstar Group which has over $9 billion of multi\\-family, hospitality and alternative real estate assets under management, primarily in Canada and the UK. www.realstar.ca/ www.realstargroup.com/
  
  

We are currently seeking a Cleaner to work at one of our apartment buildings. This position is full\\-time and would require you to work some weekends.
  
  

Key Responsibilities of Building Cleaner
  
* General cleaning of the common areas of the building (Lobbies, elevator, stairwells, windows) and amenity areas (laundry rooms, social rooms) including sweeping, vacuuming \\& mopping
* Thorough cleaning of vacant suites including cleaning appliances, walls, windows, kitchen, washrooms, balconies
* Exterior cleaning duties including general maintenance of underground garage and parking levels, service rooms, foyers, patios and rooftops (Varies by property) and picking up loose garbage/debris around the property
* Report any serious deficiency about curb appeal or safety or hazard to Resident Manager • Must be able to work flexible schedule, including weekends
* Must be able to work as part of a team and take direction
* Perform other duties as assigned


**What we offer to employees:**

title: Transportation Planner - Summer Student
description:
407 ETR Summer Student Program: Building Futures Together
At 407 ETR, we are committed to providing meaningful work experiences that empower early career professionals from underrepresented and marginalized groups. Our Summer Student Program is designed to support your growth, enhance your resume, and pave the way for a successful career.
About the Program:* Purpose: Our program aims to bridge the gap between education and professional life. As a summer student, you’ll gain hands\\-on experience, learn from industry experts, and contribute to real\\-world projects.
* Eligibility Criteria:
	+ Underrepresented Group: We encourage candidates who have identified themselves as part of an underrepresented or marginalized group to apply.
	+ Age Requirement: Applicants must be 18 years of age or older.
	+ Enrollment: You are currently enrolled as a full\\-time student at a post\\-secondary institution (college or university).
	+ Proof of Enrollment: You will need to provide proof of enrollment that you are a full\\-time post\\-secondary student.
	+ Availability: You must be available Monday through Friday during business hours from May to August.

Position Summary:
The Transportation Planner Co\\-op Role will report directly to the Manager of Traffic \\& Planning, and will assume responsibility for preparing traffic and planning reports, as well as generating data\\-driven insights through the processing, modelling, analysis, and interpretation of transportation, mobility, and spatial datasets.
Position Responsibility:* Prepare and serve as an advisor for traffic reports to senior management and shareholders, including daily traffic summaries, monthly management reports, and quarterly traffic summaries.
* Utilize state\\-of\\-the\\-art Location Based Services datasets, including Inrix, Streetlight Data, and others, to research traffic mobility trends and metrics with a special focus on the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area.
* Prepare presentation materials as required for all areas of responsibility.
* Support transportation forecasting network demand model and run analysis of network and land use scenarios as necessary.
* Assist in the preparation of the 407ETR Annual Highway Safety Review to support Highway Operations safety reporting, identify areas for improvement.
* Review and assess traffic impact studies and developments affecting the 407ETR corridor and prepares reports with recommendations to the Manager and Senior Planner.
* Undertakes, coordinates and reviews studies, research projects and data analysis as required relating to transportation in the region.


Qualifications:* Studies in Transportation Planning, Urban Geography, and/or Transportation Technology.
* Familiarity with Tableau and other Business Intelligence Data Management Software.
* Familiarity with travel demand forecasting (EMME) is preferable.
* Capabilities in GIS and graphical applications are an asset.
* Well\\-developed research and problem\\-solving skills.
* Strong communication skills and a strong work ethic.
* Ability to interact with colleagues in a positive manner within a self\\-managed team structure.


Why Choose 407 ETR:* Inclusive Environment: We foster an inclusive workplace where diversity is celebrated. Your unique perspective matters to us.
* Mentorship: Our experienced professionals will guide you, helping you develop skills that will serve you well throughout your career.
* Impactful Projects: Contribute to projects that matter. Your work will directly influence our operations and community.
* 407 ETR Usage: The highway is a taxable benefit which is provided to associates to get to and from work.


Selection Criteria:* Returning Students: We value continuity. Returning students will be considered for the program.
* Outreach Program: Our collaboration with the registrar’s office at post\\-secondary educational institutions ensures that this program serves as an outreach opportunity.
* Career Reflection: As part of the interview process, we’ll ask you to reflect on what you hope to gain from this opportunity and how it aligns with your career path.


Application Process:  

Ready to embark on this exciting journey? Visit our website to learn more about the 407 ETR Summer Student Program and submit your application. Let’s build futures together!
About 407 ETR
Highway 407 ETR is an all\\-electronic open\\-access toll highway located in the Greater Toronto Area in Ontario, Canada. The highway spans 108 kilometres from Burlington in the west to Pickering in the east.
407 International Inc. is the sole shareholder of 407 ETR and is owned by:* Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments) through indirectly\\-owned subsidiaries (50\\.01%);
* Cintra Global S.E. which is a wholly\\-owned subsidiary of Ferrovial S.A. (43\\.23%); and
* AtkinsRéalis, formally known as SNC\\-Lavalin (6\\.76%).


Note: *At 407 ETR, we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment. We value the unique perspectives and backgrounds of all individuals, and we firmly believe that our individual differences make us stronger as a whole.**Our commitment to inclusion extends beyond recruitment and encompasses an inclusive workplace culture through raising awareness, ongoing training, and encouraging feedback. We aim to create a safe and supportive environment where all employees can thrive.**Accommodation for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.*

title: Intern
description:
**DESCRIPTION**


Acosta Group Canada is seeking career driven students to join us this summer as Field Sales Representatives with our Acosta Summer Paid Internship program. Acosta can offer hands on experience in today’s work force in skills such as sales, negotiation techniques, effective problem solving, business relationships and presentation/communication skills. This valuable experience can grow into career possibilities like permanent Team Lead, District Manager, Trainer, or Account Manager.


As an intern with our Acosta Summer Paid Internship you’ll be working full time hours between Monday to Friday from May to August. No evening or weekend work! This opportunity will offer you direct experience with our top sales representatives and merchandisers to learn about territory management, retail execution and building client relationships.


Why Acosta Group Canada stands out in the competition:


We are a North American Integrated Marketing Agency. We use our collective creativity to drive commerce, conversion, and brand affinity. Our core company values shape our behavior. We are proud to offer a culture that is inclusive, responsible, and empowering. Be a part of a large corporation of good citizens that contribute to our local communities through "giving back" initiatives. Our “Think Before You Ink” campaign is just one of the many ways that our employees strive towards more sustainable practices to save our planet.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Competitive wage
* Mentorship program with leaders in our company to grow your skills
* Referral bonus program for any family and friends that want to join our team
* Extensive industry knowledge on brands you interact with every day
* Employee recognition for professional achievements
* A company that offers room for growth and internal opportunities to expand your career
* Continual education through our internal Leadership Development Program and LinkedIn Learning.

**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Be a current or recent grad of a Canadian college or university
* Be available for shifts between Monday – Friday from May – August (possibility of extension)
* Have a reliable vehicle and driver's license
* Be able to lift 30\\-50 lbs.

**ABOUT US**


Acosta Group is a collective uniting the most trusted retail, marketing, and foodservice agencies—Acosta, ActionLink, CORE Foodservice, CROSSMARK, Mosaic, Premium Retail Services, and Product Connections. Together, we connect consumers with the brands they love through omnichannel selling, merchandising, brand advocacy, and integrated marketing.


We recognize our associates are the foundation of our success. That’s why we prioritize your growth, development, and well\\-being to help you reach your full potential. With programs designed to support a fulfilling work\\-life balance, we offer opportunities that fit your lifestyle and ambitions—whether you’re looking for part\\-time flexibility or full\\-time career advancement.


Ready for a career path that’s as unique as you? Discover your path at Acosta Group!


We empower you to Discover Your Path and fully embrace BEING YOU as you shape your journey with us. At Acosta Group, we value equal opportunity in employment practices and career progression. Employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications without regard to race/ethnicity, gender/gender identity, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, and local laws. Acosta Group will provide reasonable accommodations for applicants with physical or mental disabilities to complete applications or interviews for employment. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact **EmployeeServices@acosta.com**


Acosta Group and its subsidiaries believe the posted compensation range accurately reflects this role at the time of posting. Final pay may vary based on qualifications and location, and the range may be updated in the future.


Acosta Group is an E\\-Verify employer. By applying, you agree to our Privacy Statement and Terms of Conditions.


US: http://acosta.jobs/privacy\\-policy\\-us/


Canada: http://acosta.jobs/privacy\\-policy\\-ca/


Acosta, and its subsidiaries, is an Equal Opportunity Employer

**Position Type:** Full time


**Business Unit:** Sales


**Salary Range:** $40,000\\.00 \\- $40,000\\.00


**Company:** Acosta Services Canada Co

title: Assistant Educator - Full-Time Supply
description:
Upper Canada Child Care \\- “A smile on each child’s face…every day.”
  
We are currently recruiting an Assistant Educator to join our Team in Markham at the following location(s): Ashton Meadows PS, Nokiidaa PS, Sir Wilfrid Laurier PS \\& Victoria Square PS.
  
  

**Pay Range:** Assistant $19\\.61 \\- $22\\.41/hour plus Wage Enhancement Grant ($2\\.00/hr) and Split Shift Premium ($2\\.00/hr).
  
  

* Candidates must be available to work a split shift in a before and after school program.


**Position Type \\& Required Availability:**  

* Full\\-time Supply Position (25\\-40 hours/week): Candidates must be available to work a split\\-shift (morning and afternoon) in our Before \\& After School programs or a full day (8\\-hour shift) Monday\\-Friday to be considered.


**Who We Are:**  

Upper Canada Child Care, non\\-profit licensed provider since 1983, operates 85\\+ centres in Toronto, York Region, and Simcoe County. We offer full\\-day and before and after school programs, summer camps, and a forest school. Guided by values of support, trust, safety, respect, and professionalism, we prioritize play\\-based learning and outdoor exploration. We invest in quality program delivery, providing specialized supports and training. Ministry of Education licensed, our programs reflect the four foundations of learning. Join us and help put “a smile on each child’s face…every day.”
  
  

**What We Offer Our Educators:**  

As a large and growing organization, we have the ability to offer competitive compensation and rewards, including regular pay increases, wage enhancement grants, paid personal days, medical and dental benefits, split shift premium pay, paid training and development, involvement in charity initiatives, long term service awards, childcare discounts, group RRSP program, formal mentorship program and the opportunity to advance and move throughout the organization. Upper Canada Child Care also operates summer day camps at select locations, in addition to unique programs such as residential camp and forest school.
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

To ensure operational and curriculum requirements are met in compliance with all Ministry and organizational guidelines. To ensure the delivery of a developmentally appropriate, play based program by applying specialized skills and knowledge related to early childhood education. Supports the organization’s vision, mission, and guiding values. This is a fully in\\-centre position.
  
  

**Job Responsibilities:**  

* Applies current legislative expectations to support a program that is consistent with Ministry of Education requirements and in accordance with Upper Canada Child Care’s program statement.
* Participates in professional development opportunities, staff meetings and training sessions as required.
* Engages with the children and provides a positive learning experience. Provides a range of care including assisting with meals/snacks, toileting, diapering, dressing, etc.
* Fosters the engagement of and ongoing communication with parents about the program and their children.
* Completes program charts, daily logs, reports, and other administration tasks as required.
* Uses Storypark for pedagogical documentation as a guide for program development.
* Effectively collaborates and communicates with other team members, school personnel, and outside agencies to help support the needs of all children.
* Provides guidance to students and volunteers as needed.
* Identifies children in need of additional support. Guides parents through the process of accessing resources. Helps design and implement individual support plans as required.


**Qualifications \\& Requirements:**  

* A recent Vulnerable Sector Check
* Health assessment and record of immunization, as outlined by legislation.
* Up\\-to\\-date certification in CPR\\-C and Standard First Aid
* Basic knowledge of the developmental needs of children and demonstrated ability to apply this knowledge.
* Experience with inquiry/play based program design and implementation, and with the use of pedagogical documentation an asset.
* Uses initiative; applies sound reason in solving problems and resolves conflict in a calm, professional manner.
* Proven ability to communicate (written and verbal) effectively and establish appropriate relationships with families, coworkers and other professionals.
* Have the physical and emotional stamina to effectively supervise children in a variety of settings including outdoor public spaces.
* Ability to use computer systems and programs; including Dayforce, and Storypark.
* Moderate level of physical effort is regularly required; including but not limited to kneeling, pushing, pulling, bending, and carrying.


Please apply by clicking on the available link, or email your resume to hr@ucccc.ca
  
  

Upper Canada Child Care is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and encourages applications from members of our diverse communities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact the interviewer in advance if you require accommodations.
  
  

Thank you for your interest; only applicants who may be interviewed will be contacted.
  
  

Don’t forget to check us out on Facebook, Instagram, “X” \\& LinkedIn!

FHC is a registered charity and an incorporated not\\-for\\-profit Community Health Centre (CHC), with a vision of Strong Healthy Communities. Across our three sites, we provide a range of health\\-related services based on the social determinants of health with extensive community engagement.

Position Summary:

At Flemingdon Health Centre (FHC), we are excited to participate in the Canada Summer Jobs (CSJ) Program, offering meaningful paid summer job opportunities for youth to gain valuable work experience in the healthcare and community services sector.

As a Canada Summer Student, you will support a variety of projects and day\\-to\\-day operations across several teams. These roles offer students hands\\-on exposure to real\\-world tasks in a collaborative, professional, and community\\-focused environment. This summer, we are hiring for the following departments:

Summer Job Opportunities at FHC

· Respectful, adaptable, and compassionate approach to working with diverse communities

· Excellent communication and organizational skills

· Must provide a current Vulnerable Sector Police Check

Eligibility – Canada Summer Jobs Criteria:

· Must be between 15 and 30 years old at the start of employment

· Must be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or have official refugee status in Canada

· Must have a valid Social Insurance Number (SIN)

· International students are not eligible

Why Work with Us?

At FHC, we’re more than a workplace—we’re a community. Join us this summer and:

· Gain valuable professional experience

· Work in a diverse and mission\\-driven organization

· Build skills that will support your future career in health or community services

*We encourage applications from individuals who can identify with the diverse communities we serve. We thank all applicants for their interest but regret that only those selected for an interview will receive an acknowledgement. Please note that a criminal background check (Vulnerable sector) will be conducted for this position. In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. title: Summer Camp Leader
company: The Sharon Temple National Historic Site and Museum
description:
Sharon Museum \\& Gardens (formerly the Sharon Temple National Historic Site \\& Museum) is an open\\-air museum with eight heritage buildings and two interpretive buildings located on\\-site. The Museum is located in the heart of East Gwillimbury on four acres and features three heritage gardens in addition to the collection of heritage buildings on\\-site. Each summer, we offer six weeks of themed summer camps that strive to provide a positive, educational, and rewarding experience for all campers.

The ideal candidate will have an interest in recreation and education and possess programming experience in a camp environment. The ideal candidate will be able to supervise other camp staff, maintain an energetic and positive attitude, and set forth an effective camp program. They will be creative and organized, which will contribute to a successful summer of camp programming. They will also have excellent customer service.

**Primary Job Functions:** 

* Plan and program six weeks of day camp programs for participants aged 6 \\-12 around themes such as nature, STEM, history, and physical activity, including administrative and evaluation measures.
* Implement six weeks of day camp by maintaining an organized and planned schedule for children and staff to follow, which will include tracking attendance, permission forms, and camper information.
* Supervise and lead two other camp staff members and assume responsibility for all campers in order to provide a welcoming and safe camp environment.
* Maintain positive communication between campers, parents, managers, partnering groups, and staff throughout the summer.

**General Duties:** 

* Provide interpretation to the public through tours, education, and outreach programs.
* Support event implementation and assist with program preparation.
* Assist staff with daily attendance tracking, gift shop inventory, and cash balancing.
* Provide support as needed for other staff members.
* Other tasks as required.

**Qualifications:**

* Two years of previous camp experience, preferably one year in a supervisor role.
* Currently enrolled or graduated from post\\-secondary studies in a related field, such as Education, Early Childhood Education, or Recreation and Leisure.
* Have an interest in the fields of Education, Recreation, or Leisure.
* Previous experience working with the public in a structured setting, in a paid and/or volunteer capacity.
* Ability to balance multiple priorities.
* Ability to handle difficult and confidential situations, possessing strong conflict resolution skills.
* Candidate must be between the ages of 15\\-30 and legally entitled to work in Canada.
* Must possess or be willing to train for Standard First Aid and CPR.
* Must possess or be willing to obtain a Vulnerable Sector Screening.
* Be prepared to work a variety of shifts, including weekends and evenings.

**Physical Requirements:**

Sharon Museum \\& Gardens is located north of Toronto on 4\\.5 acres. As this is a large site with multiple heritage buildings, the candidate will be required to move between these buildings and around the site as needed to conduct various activities. The ability to lift 30 pounds is required.

**Please submit a** **resume and cover letter** **to madison@sharonmuseumandgardens.ca. Subject line: Camp Leader – \\[Last Name]. Please be advised that there will be a small assignment given as part of the interview process.** 

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position; however, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. This position is a full\\-time temporary contract, 35 hours per week, and the contract is for 12 weeks beginning June 2nd, 2025\\.

Sharon Museum \\& Gardens is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier\\-free recruitment and selection processes. We always encourage the Government of Canada’s job equity groups to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest in this position; however, only applications selected for an interview will be contacted. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.
