title: Summer Student - Information & Technology, PRO
description:
About Touchstone Institute

  



Touchstone Institute is the largest assessment centre of its kind in Canada, providing professional competency assessment and learning programs to support the delivery of high\\-quality health care.

  




Touchstone Institute is a non\\-profit corporation governed by a board of directors and receives financial support from the Government of Ontario. Currently implementing a growth strategy, Touchstone Institute looks to expand its impact in supporting broad health human resource solutions and by strengthening effective practice of health care professionals. Nearly 40 full\\-time staff contribute to the success of the organization, including experts in competency design and assessment, as well as health and education program development.

  



Touchstone Institute works closely with physicians, nurses and other healthcare providers who provide subject matter expertise to assess and improve the level of competency across individual practice. Building on its history of working to facilitate entry to training or practice for Internationally Educated Health Professionals, Touchstone Institute seeks to continue the work in this area while expanding to support excellence in competent practice for all who deliver health care.

  



About Practice Ready Ontario (PRO)



Funded by the Government of Ontario, Touchstone Institute works closely with the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario, the Medical Council of Canada, and others while administering the PRO program. PRO is a workplace assessment program that aims to add internationally trained family physicians or general practitioners who have completed post\\-graduate training and have an established track record of work in another country to practice in rural communities in Ontario.

  



Position Description

  



Touchstone Institute is seeking a detail\\-oriented and analytically minded IT Summer Student, PRO to join our team for an exciting project focused on modernizing our PRO Portal’s automatic eligibility and screening tool and the PRO Dashboard. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to a meaningful initiative aimed at improving the efficiency and accuracy of candidate screening in support of Ontario’s healthcare workforce.

  



The PRO Portal’s automatic screening tool is a vital part of our application process, using a flagging system to identify potential eligibility concerns. As the IT Summer Student, PRO, you will lead a comprehensive review of the current flagging system, working with both the PRO team and the IT team to enhance its accuracy, usability, and automation capabilities. Your work will help reduce unnecessary manual reviews and streamline the applicant experience.

  



Key Accountabilities

  



® Conduct a full audit of the PRO Portal’s current flagging system to identify errors, redundancies, or misapplied flags.



® Analyze candidate application trends to detect common issues or misunderstandings that result in false flags.



® Collaborate with the PRO team to conduct a needs analysis of the screening process and identify gaps.



® Develop a plan to revise flag\\-triggering questions for improved clarity and accuracy.



® Create detailed deliverables including:


* A report on flag errors and discrepancies


* A needs analysis for the screening system


* A flag question review and update plan


* A candidate issue analysis report


* An implementation and portal testing plan


* A training plan to support internal adoption of updated processes



® Work with the IT team on the development and testing of recommended portal updates.



® Present findings and proposals to internal stakeholders for feedback and next steps.

  



What You’ll Gain



® Firsthand experience in systems analysis and process optimization in a not\\-for\\-profit, mission\\-driven organization.



® Insight into how proprietary software is designed and used to support organizational needs.



® Opportunities to contribute to cross\\-functional collaboration between business operations and IT development.



® Professional mentorship from senior team members in IT and program administration.

  



Qualifications



® Currently enrolled in a post\\-secondary program in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.



® Strong understanding of software systems databases and how they support business processes



® UI/UX design skills or experience building user interfaces is considered a strong asset.



® Excellent analytical thinking and problem\\-solving skills



® Advanced written and verbal communication skills



® Exceptional attention to detail



® Ability to manage time effectively and work independently



® Comfortable working in a collaborative, cross\\-functional team environment

  


**We follow a hybrid work model with two designated in\\-office days: Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Successful candidates must be available to work on\\-site during these days.**

  




**How to Apply:**Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your interest and qualifications. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

  


**Contract Term: May to August**


**Application closing date: April 24, 2025**

title: Accommodation Support Facilitator - Part-time
description:
Upper Canada Child Care \\- “A smile on each child’s face…every day.”
  
  

We are currently recruiting Accommodation Support Facilitator to join our Team in Markham at the following location: Victoria Square PS.
  
  

* This is a temporary position until June 27, 2025\\.


**Pay Rate:** $19\\.55/hour
  
  

* Candidates must be available to work a split shift in a before and after school program.


**Position Type \\& Required Availability:**  

* Part\\-time Position (15 hours/week): Candidates must be available to work a 3\\-hour shift.


**Who We Are:**  

Upper Canada Child Care, non\\-profit licensed provider since 1983, operates 85\\+ centres in Toronto, York Region, and Simcoe County. We offer full\\-day and before and after school programs, summer camps, and a forest school. Guided by values of support, trust, safety, respect, and professionalism, we prioritize play\\-based learning and outdoor exploration. We invest in quality program delivery, providing specialized supports and training. Ministry of Education licensed, our programs reflect the four foundations of learning. Join us and help put “a smile on each child’s face…every day.”
  
  

**What We Offer Our Educators:**  

As a large and growing organization, we have the ability to offer competitive compensation and rewards, including regular pay increases, wage enhancement grants, paid personal days, medical and dental benefits, split shift premium pay, paid training and development, involvement in charity initiatives, long term service awards, childcare discounts, group RRSP program, formal mentorship program and the opportunity to advance and move throughout the organization. Upper Canada Child Care also operates summer day camps at select locations, in addition to unique programs such as residential camp and forest school.
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

To assist the teachers in program delivery ensuring operational requirements are met in compliance with all internal and external guidelines, policies and procedures. The overarching goal is to enhance the classroom ratio and provide an inclusive environment through ongoing collaboration and communication. Supports the organization’s vision, mission, and guiding values. This is a fully in\\-centre position.
  
  

**Job Responsibilities:**  

* Supports a program that is consistent with Ministry of Education requirements and in accordance with Upper Canada Child Care’s program statement.
* Assists with program charts, daily logs, reports and administration tasks as required.
* Participates in professional development opportunities, staff meetings and training sessions as required.
* Works to support and maintain an inclusive environment.
* Accepts direction from other staff members in order to best support the program.
* May be required to interact with children on a 1:1 basis and/or supervise a group of children.
* Provides information to parents when requested and encourages family engagement.
* Observes pedagogical documentation as a guide for program development.
* Contributes to the design of Individual Support Plans and supports the implementation with full effort in collaboration with the Inclusion Support team.
* May attend meetings with internal and/or external agencies and individuals as part of the Individual Support Plan.
* Performs general housekeeping and classroom duties for children aged 0\\-12 years (e.g. meal/snack preparation, toileting, diapering, dressing, etc).


**Qualifications and Requirements:**  

* A recent Police Vulnerable Sector Check.
* At least 18 years of age or older due to licensing requirements.
* Health assessment and up\\-to\\-date record of immunization as outlined by legislation.
* Up\\-to\\-date certification in CPR\\-C and Standard First Aid (training provided upon selection if required).
* Basic understanding of special needs and knowledge of the developmental needs of children and demonstrated ability to apply this knowledge.
* Proven ability to communicate (written and verbal) effectively and establish appropriate relationships with families, caregivers and other professionals.
* Ability to remain calm under pressure.
* Uses initiative; applies sound reason in solving problems and resolves conflict in an effective, professional manner.
* Have the physical and emotional stamina to effectively supervise children in a variety of settings including outdoor public spaces.
* Ability to use computer systems and programs; including Dayforce, and Storypark.
* Moderate level of physical effort is regularly required; including but not limited to kneeling, pushing, pulling, bending, and carrying.


Upper Canada Child Care is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and encourages applications from members of our diverse communities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact the interviewer in advance if you require accommodations.
  
  

Thank you for your interest; only applicants who may be interviewed will be contacted.
  
  

Don’t forget to check us out on Facebook, Instagram, “X” \\& LinkedIn!

title: E-Commerce Agent
description:
**E\\-Commerce Agent Role Description:**


### **Who is Grill Hero?**


What began as a small summer venture has grown into North America's trusted brand to offer 360\\-degree grill services. In doing so, Grill Hero enhances their community's ability to have a safe \\& enjoyable place to create memories and experiences with their friends and families. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and barrier\\-free workplace that celebrates diversity.


***The Hero Mission***


Our mission is to enhance barbecue health, safety, and performance, helping grillers make the most of every grilling experience.


***Thrive***


**HERO Values**


**HONESTY** **EMPATHY** **RELIABILITY OPENNESS**


These values guide our decision\\-making and have allowed us to build a business based on trust, accountability to results, commitment to improvement, and our focus on Winning Together!


**Day in the Life**


As an E\\-commerce Agent at Grill Hero, you will be a key player in our online order operations, ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and outstanding customer support every step of the way. From verifying and entering customer orders to coordinating inventory and shipping logistics, your role is essential to delivering a seamless and satisfying e\\-commerce experience. You'll manage inbound and outbound communications, oversee order fulfillment, and proactively address potential issues with professionalism and attention to detail. This position is ideal for individuals who are highly organized, thrive in a fast\\-paced environment, and are committed to maintaining high standards of customer care and operational excellence.


**Live**  

**What We Expect:**


**Core Responsibilities**


* **Order Entry \\& Verification:** Accurately enter customer orders into the system, confirming order details, payment information, and shipping addresses to ensure data integrity and customer satisfaction.
* **Inventory Management:** Monitor and maintain inventory levels; proactively communicate potential shortages or restocking needs to the appropriate teams.
* **Order Fulfillment Coordination:** Ensure timely and accurate picking, packing, labeling, and preparation of customer orders for shipment.
* **Shipping \\& Logistics Coordination:** Manage shipping processes by scheduling pickups, tracking shipments, and resolving delivery issues to ensure timely and accurate order delivery.
* **Inbound \\& Outbound Calling:** Handle inbound customer inquiries and make outbound calls as needed to confirm orders, provide updates, or resolve issues, always delivering a professional and helpful customer experience.


**Win**  

**You're Great At:**


* Staying organized and paying close attention to details.
* Accurately entering and verifying information in systems.
* Managing multiple tasks and prioritizing deadlines.
* Communicating clearly and professionally, both over the phone and in writing.
* Working well with others across teams (like customer service, warehouse, and shipping).
* Solving problems quickly and staying calm under pressure.
* Taking initiative and spotting issues before they become problems.
* Learning new systems and processes quickly.


**Qualifications:**


* 1\\+ years in order fulfillment and supply chain management.
* Class G Valid driver's license.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.
* Comfortable using computers, order management systems, and basic software.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to manage time effectively and stay organized in a fast\\-paced environment.
* A proactive mindset with strong problem\\-solving ability.
* Experience handling inbound and outbound phone calls in a professional setting.


**Benefits:**


* Performance\\-based incentives
* Opportunities for career growth
* Be part of a company with an outstanding culture that values teamwork, respect, and a positive work environment, making every day enjoyable and rewarding.

title: Dock Staff
description:
**Tiki Taxi Dock Staff – Be the First Smile People See on Their Island Adventure!** 

Love the water, the sun, and helping people have a great day? We’re looking for enthusiastic and reliable individuals to join our Water Taxi team as Dock Staff!

**Location:** Tiki Taxi \\- Water Taxi dock.  
**Type:** Seasonal / Part\\-Time / Full\\-Time / Weekend Availability

* **Assist with Fare Collection** – Help collect money from passengers and keep things running smoothly.
* **Keep Things Moving** – Organize passenger lines and maintain order at the dock.
* **Load \\& Unload** – Lend a hand with bikes, bags, coolers, or anything else passengers bring aboard.
* **Tiki Phone Duty** – Manage the tiki phone to dispatch boats for pickups as needed.
* **Be the Friendly Face** – Greet pedestrians, offer rides to the Islands, and spread good vibes!

**You’re a Great Fit If You:**

* Enjoy working outdoors and by the water
* Can lift/carry heavy items like bikes/e\\-bikes and coolers when helping guests
* Have strong communication and customer service skills
* Are dependable, organized, and proactive
* Are friendly, outgoing, and love talking to people

No prior dock experience needed — we’ll train the right person. Boating knowledge is a plus, but not required!

**Perks of the Job:**

* Work outside by the water
* Fun, team\\-oriented environment
* Flexible shifts
* Free rides to the Islands when you're off duty !

Ready to hop aboard? Send us your resume or a short note about yourself and why you’d be a great fit.

**Apply now and spend your summer on the dock !**

At Flemingdon Health Centre (FHC), we are excited to offer an Accounting Canada Summer Student opportunity as part of the Canada Summer Jobs (CSJ) Program. We are looking for energetic camp counselors for our Mississauga and Oakville locations. Duties would include leading a group of kids in one or more camps including: Crafts, STEM, Lego robotics, baking, sports development, Creator Camp (film making, youtube, special effects, cartoon animation)

* Following the direction of the Site Supervisor and working within a team structure both offering and accepting help as needed

title: Examiner
description:
**The Company**


ILAC Education Group is an industry leader with a mission to change lives through education and create opportunities for international students to achieve their dreams. For 28 years ILAC has offered thousands of international students an immersive learning experience with award\\-winning English language programs, cultural diversity, exceptional customer service and beautiful campuses in Toronto, Vancouver and now Whistler with Tamwood. Our offerings include high school, language training, summer camps, higher education programs, university pathways, work \\& study, testing venues, accommodations, employment support and international agent training. **Overview**  

ILAC Testing Centre is looking for individuals with the pre\\-requisites to be trained as IELTS Speaking Examiners for our team. Examiners conduct and assess face\\-to\\-face, in\\-person speaking interviews with IELTS test takers.

 **Pre\\-requisites:**

* An English level equivalent to Band 9 IELTS
* An undergraduate degree
* A recognized qualification in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL).
* At least 3 years full\\-time (or the equivalent part\\-time) relevant TESOL teaching experience (classroom not tutoring)
* The required professional attributes and interpersonal skills.

  

Applicants must be willing to work at locations transit\\-accessible locations across Toronto.


Training is free for successful applicants who are willing to make a minimum 2\\-year commitment to ILAC IELTS Testing.


Test sessions run 7\\-days per week and Examiners are expected to be available **for at least 2 Saturday shifts per month plus other dates as preferred**. Pay rates are $45\\-$60 per hour.


Intensive training seminars and certification session for the speaking module will be held the week beginning April 14th 2025\\.


\\#ILACH

  

ILAC is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility to Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted, please advise should you require accommodation during the hiring process.

title: Camp Counsellor/After School Leader
description:
Welcome to the Nonsensical Society for Kids, here we want our members to be their full authentic selves, and to provide programming that supports exploration, self esteem \\& community building. We challenge kids to think outside the box, follow their creativity and get messy! Whether we are in the middle of a ravine with our socks wet, getting our hands stained from tie\\-dye, or sweating from an intense round of Everybody’s It Tag, we always give everything our all! Our team believes in being role models who radiate positivity, have a passion for play and love to learn from the world around them.

This position is unique as it provides opportunity for both a Camp Counsellor role taking place during the summer with the extension of staying on with NSK throughout the school year as an After School Leader.

**Responsibilities**

*Camp Counsellor*

* Support and participate in a variety of games and activities with campers of different ages.
* Work cooperatively with Lead Camp Counsellors to ensure campers are safe.
* Demonstrate leadership ability when assisting Junior Camp Counsellors and relief staff.
* Maintain constant surveillance of the pool/body of water areas.
* Understand and enforce all safety guidelines associated with the pool/beach/park.

*After School Leader*

* Picking up members from school and bringing them to their chosen program that day.
* Facilitating \\& assisting with the programs available.
* Engaging with the members \\& their caregivers to build connections.
* Work cooperatively with the team.
* Support \\& participate with members during both structured and free time activities.

**Required Skills**

* Enjoy working with children in a fun environment!
* Demonstrates communication, leadership, patience, and time management.
* Ability to work outdoors in various weather.
* Comfortable swimming in pools and open bodies of water.
* Ability to stand, walk, bend, etc. during a 8 hour shift.

**Qualifications**

* Previous experience working in summer camp setting is required.
* Criminal/Background Check.
* First Aid/CPR certificate.

Nonsensical Society for Kids is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualification. We do not discriminate against applicants based on their race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, or disability, or any other status or condition protected by applicable provincial law. Nonsensical Society for Kids encourages candidates of diverse backgrounds to apply. Should an accommodation be necessary for the interview process, please email us. We’d love to hear from you! We acknowledge the land we are meeting on is the traditional territory of many nations including the Mississaugas of the Credit, the Anishnabeg, the Chippewa, the Haudenosaunee and the Wendat peoples and is now home to many diverse First Nations, Inuit and Métis peoples. We also acknowledge that Toronto is covered by Treaty 13 with the Mississaugas of the Credit.

title: Festival Contractors
description:
Job Summary:


**\\*\\* This is an onsite role to support summer festival events throughout Canada\\*\\***

**THE TEAM**

We’re fans who help fans everywhere access the live events they love. A proud division of Live Nation Entertainment, Ticketmaster has changed the way the world connects with their favorite artists, teams, and shows, and we continue to shape innovation every day. We’re not just selling tickets (though we do that better than anyone else!), we’re enriching lives one amazing experience at a time. And we think that’s pretty amazing. If you’re passionate about the magic of live entertainment like we are, and you want to work at a company dedicated to helping millions of fans experience it, we want you on our team.


**THE JOB**

Working primarily with the Front Gate ticketing system, this position delivers operational services and support to Ticketmaster’s festival business clients (venues and promoters) while on site at our festival events. The Festival Operations Specialist (FOS) is responsible for coordinating and executing the ticketing needs of festival operations in collaboration with multiple departments and clients. This role includes significant client facing components as well as a requirement for a very strong technical understanding of our products and equipment.


**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING**

**Operational Support**

* Install, support and deploy various equipment and services at festival locations;
* Provide best practices, training and support of client event and box office needs where required;
* Oversee a TM staffed Box Office team where required;
* Maintain maximum site efficiencies through collaboration with other on\\-site teams and third\\-party providers;
* Ensure timely and accurate reporting on live event statistics and access control;
* Maintain inventory and upkeep of technology assets

**Problem Resolution**

* Use troubleshooting techniques and tools to identify the root cause of issues;
* Research client/customer complaints about service levels;
* Work with National/Central support groups to expedite problem resolution;
* Troubleshoot software and hardware issues;
* Coordinate networking issues;
* Work with Customer Service for events with problems and/or special circumstances

**WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW (or TECHNICAL SKILLS)**

* 3\\+ years festival, ticketing or other related experience
* Bilingualism (written and oral); English and French is strong asset
* Experience with FrontGate or Ticketmaster software and hardware is preferred
* Strong computer skills, especially MS Word and Excel
* Demonstrated organizational and critical thinking skills, paired with a keen attention to detail
* Able to successfully manage multiple and competing priorities in a time sensitive environment
* Autonomous and able to work under minimal supervision
* Reliable, adaptable and team\\-oriented
* Must be able to meet the physical and technical demands of remote festival locations with little to no infrastructure
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 25 pounds unassisted, and able to push and pull rolling carts and cases weighing up to 100 pounds unassisted
* Must be able to show flexibility in schedule and location to accommodate festivals (work multiple days in a row beyond a standard work week, or shift lengths beyond a standard work day)
* Travel required
* A passion for live events!

**YOU (BEHAVIOURAL SKILLS)**

* **Business Acumen** – You understand and can apply general business concepts, using external networks to understand market situations and industry.
* **Problem Solving and Innovation** – Gathering appropriate perspective and insights and seeking win\\-win solutions by remaining open to alternative approaches and being proactive in generating new ideas. Ability to maintain a balanced perspective and see all sides of an issue and manage problems in a timely and effective manner. A free and independent thinker, open to new ideas and concepts.
* **Organizational Skills** – Manages competing priorities of several teams/departments/locations. Tasks and project management orientation (with the ability to hold others accountable).
* **Winning Teamwork** – Collaborating with others in a respectful manner and openly sharing information amongst the team to assist in achieving Ticketmaster goals and objectives. Taking the time to empathize and understand where others are coming from, along with showing recognition and appreciation for the contribution of others.

**LIFE AT TICKETMASTER**

We are proud to be a part of Live Nation Entertainment, the world’s largest live entertainment company.


Our vision at Ticketmaster is to connect people around the world to the live events they love. As the world’s largest ticket marketplace and the leading global provider of enterprise tools and services for the live entertainment business, we are uniquely positioned to successfully deliver on that vision.


We do it all with an intense passion for Live and an inspiring and diverse culture driven by accessible leaders, attentive managers, and enthusiastic teams. If you’re passionate about live entertainment like we are, and you want to work at a company dedicated to helping millions of fans experience it, we want to hear from you.


**Our work is guided by our values:**

**Reliability** \\- We understand that fans and clients rely on us to power their live event experiences, and we rely on each other to make it happen.


**Teamwork** \\- We believe individual achievement pales in comparison to the level of success that can be achieved by a team


**Integrity** \\- We are committed to the highest moral and ethical standards on behalf of the countless partners and stakeholders we represent


**Belonging** \\- We are committed to building a culture in which all people can be their authentic selves, have an equal voice and opportunities to thrive


**EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES**

We are passionate and committed to our people and go beyond the rhetoric of diversity and inclusion. You will be working in an inclusive environment and be encouraged to bring your whole self to work. We will do all that we can to help you successfully balance your work and homelife. As a growing business we will encourage you to develop your professional and personal aspirations, enjoy new experiences, and learn from the talented people you will be working with. It's talent that matters to us and we encourage applications from people irrespective of their gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability status or caring responsibilities.


Ticketmaster Canada will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process. If you have difficulty using our online application system and need an accommodation due to a disability, please email accessibilitycanada@ticketmaster.ca . Please note this inbox is limited to accommodation requests. Resumes submitted to this inbox will not be considered.

title: Games Customer Service Attendant
description:
Global Amusement Consulting (GAC) builds and operates games and attractions for amusement parks throughout North America. Our business is unique, as we have the opportunity and ability to *Create Fun Experiences* for our clients, our customers, and our team. No matter how big or how small, our actions make positive impacts in a variety of ways. Within our Theme Park operations, we have the opportunity to deliver fun and memorable experiences. Our Games and Attractions Ambassadors facilitate the operation of various games of skill that we are contracted to manage on behalf of Canada's Wonderland. The ideal candidates must be reliable, and punctual, possessing positive enthusiasm and a can do attitude. These are customer service positions that require exceptional interaction with guests on a daily basis. You must possess strong oral and written English language and grammar skills, as well as basic math skills. This is a seasonal position, which can range from part\\-time to 40 hours per week depending on your preference and schedule. We need personnel who are available to work days, evenings, weekends, and Holidays during the course of the Operating Season (https://www.canadaswonderland.com/calendar\\-and\\-hours) which includes weekends during the spring and fall, and weekdays during the course of the summer. Flexible hours and other benefits provided. Must be able to pass background checks and drug screening, and complete the online interview questions.

Pay: From $17\\.20 per hour

Expected hours: 12 – 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Associate Product Manager Co-Op/Intern
description:
At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.

**Why is this role important?**

**Summer 2025 Work Term**


Term Length: 4 months


Term Start: May 5, 2025


Term End: August 22, 2025

  

As of October 15, 2024 Loblaw has adopted the following Hybrid working model (a combination of working between the office and remotely). Colleagues will continue working remotely up to 1 day a week, while spending the other 4 days in the office (to be determined by each business unit).


At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the loyalty, online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces.

  

  

Do you love the thought of working on Canada’s Largest and Most Loved Loyalty Program – PC Optimum? Yes? We want to hear from you! We are building Canada’s \\#1 Loyalty experience and want to transform and simplify how customers shop. We need big ideas, enthusiasm and lot of diverse ideas to come together and make this a reality.

  

The impact you’ll make:


As an Associate Product Manager for PC Optimum, you’ll have the opportunity to work along side the design and engineering teams to develop and launch new features for Canada’s largest loyalty program. If you’re enthusiastic about user experience, technology, business and Loyalty Programs this is where you belong!


What You'll Do:

* Work with Product Designers and Engineering to help shape the upcoming sprints and larger product roadmap
* Support product backlog \\- including daily prioritization, grooming, writing user stories and helping keep the dev team unblocked
* Assist in product discovery to validate new ideas and start framing new features and their prioritization
* Use analytics to make key product decisions
* Participate in collecting feedback from users and translating these findings into product ideas

Does This Sound Like You?

* You can easily build relationships and have been part of large, cross functional teams that are working to solve complex problems and build products for millions of Canadians (both customers and colleagues)
* You have a customer first approach to building products, leveraging research and data paired with empathy to build experiences that create customer stickiness
* You have an entrepreneurial spirit and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get the job done
* You are obsessed with testing and experimentation is a core pillar of how you approach product development – aka you aren’t happy unless you’ve learned something after shipping
* You’ve got a growth mindset – you know there’s always a better way to do things and are willing to disrupt yourself or the status quo
  

What You'll Need:

* Experience working closely with Engineering, Data Science \\& other business functions.
* Some experience in product management / software development
* Understanding of lean startup
* Understanding of agile (scrum/kanban)
* Understanding of Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics
* Ability to work independently and sift through ambiguity
* Strong attention to detail and project management skill

How You’ll Succeed: At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.

**How You’ll Succeed:**


At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.


We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.


If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.


Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.


Apply today.

**Employment Type:**


Full time**Type of Role:**


Temporary (Fixed Term)
Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.


In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

title: Receiver - Part-time (Summer Seasonal)
description:
The Royal Canadian Yacht Club was founded in Toronto in 1852\\.The RCYC operates year\\-round from two facilities: our summer home at the Island Clubhouse and our City Clubhouse in downtown Toronto. With over 4000 Members we have extensive services in Food and Beverage along with Fitness, Sports and Sailing facilities.

title: Records Management Administrator (6 Months)
description:
**Who We Are**
RioCan is one of Canada's largest Real Estate Investment Trusts (REIT). We own, manage and develop retail\\-focused, increasingly mixed\\-use properties in Canada's major markets. We pioneered the REIT concept over 30 years ago and have transformed Canadian real estate.

We are proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Greenest Employers and a Greater Toronto's Top Employer. At RioCan, you can build a career with real impact and longevity. You get the stability and resources of an established company and the entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit of a start\\-up. Life at RioCan is dynamic and fast\\-paced. We know that great ideas can come from anywhere, and we empower our people to suggest and implement them. We value different voices and perspectives and appreciate that the unique backgrounds and identities we each bring to our jobs make the whole business stronger. **POSITIONOVERVIEW:**
Join our dynamic and highly engaged team as a Records Management Intern. This role will assist in managing various risks related to regulation, data protection, and records and information management. The Records Management Intern will play a key part in maintaining RioCan’s compliance with records retention requirements and demonstrating a strong commitment to Records Management and data governance best practices.
### **RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Support Compliance: Promote adherence to RioCan policies and processes concerning data protection and records retention and disposition
* Team Collaboration: Assist the Records Management team by coordinating activities across the Trust related to records and information retention
* Departmental Support: Help departments comply with specific data retention requirements, including large\\-scale metadata processing.
* Data Classification: Engage in data classification activities to ensure proper organization and protection
* Training and Education: Prepare training materials and conduct training sessions to educate staff on records management best practices.
* System Enhancements: Participate in testing and rolling out system enhancements to improve records management processes
* Physical Records Management: Liaise with department staff on the retrieval and disposition of physical records
* Ad\\-hoc Duties: Perform additional tasks as required to support the team

### **QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Degree or Diploma in library and information sciences, or equivalent work experience
* Proven organizational skills, dedication to teamwork, time\\-management, and attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills (both oral and written)
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and changing priorities
* Knowledge and understanding of client service
* Ability to work in a busy, deadline driven environment focused on accuracy and confidentiality
* Problem solving skills and use of sound judgment
* Willingness to take on new tasks and embrace change
* Experience with SharePoint in a compliance or data function, with experience in records and information management, records classification, data mapping, and other data protection activities will be considered an asset

**Why join RioCan?**  

We believe in rewarding you for what you do and investing in your career and long\\-term success. Our total rewards and perquisites program is designed to fit and enrich your life physically, emotionally, financially, and socially. We offer eligible employees:

**Work / Life Balance** that prioritizes YOU. Enjoy a hybrid work model with flexible work hours, an extra\\-long weekend with our RioCan Cares Day, and half days before every long weekend in the summer.
**Professional Growth and Development** that includes a continuing education reimbursement, a mentorship and leadership development program, on\\-demand online learning, and cross\\-training opportunities.

An **Extensive Health and Benefits Program** that includes health and dental benefits for you and your family starting on day one, a healthcare spending account, an employee family and assistance program, virtual healthcare, and other resources.

A **Comprehensive Retirement Program** to help prepare our employees for the future. This includes matching employee contributions in a retirement savings plan, pension plan, and an employee unit purchase plan.
**Additional Perks and Benefits** that include paid time off, parental leave top\\-up, various employee discounts, employee referral and recognition programs, and opportunities to participate in community initiatives, committees, and social events throughout the year.

We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment where all employees are valued, included, and empowered to do their best work and bring great ideas. People are at the core of who we are, and we respect that they have taken all paths to get here. RioCan welcomes applications from all candidates and is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process, please let us know, and we will be happy to work with you to meet your needs.  

You can visit us at **www.riocan.com** and follow us on **LinkedIn** to learn more about who we are and what a career at RioCan can look like for you.

title: Event Planner
description:
Yonge North York Business Improvement Area (BIA) serves 1600 member businesses and commercial property owners in the area along Yonge between the 401 and Bishop Avenue. Our vision is to be the preferred destination in North Toronto for businesses, residents, visitors and workers to live, work and play. Assisting our members and delivering relevant support is a priority.

**Reports to:** Executive Director and Marketing \\& Economic Development Manager

**Key Accountabilities**

* Integral to orchestrating a variety of community events, including popular summer food festivals, cultural happenings, and winter holiday celebrations.
* Actively engages the public and works collaboratively with local businesses to promote participation, with a special focus on newcomers, youth, and seniors, aligning with local priorities.
* The diverse cultural backdrop of the area is showcased through these events, offering a variety of experiences to the community. In addition to supporting seasonal festivals, the planner is tasked with developing new event concepts that contribute to local economic growth and specifically cater to targeted groups, in line with both local and national priorities.
* Involves a range of responsibilities, from creating promotional materials, acting as an ambassador for the organization at events and managing logistics to implementing media and marketing efforts. Essential to this position is the ability to work weekends and communicate effectively in one or more languages prevalent in the community, such as Korean, Mandarin, or Cantonese, or Farsi, enhancing inclusivity and engagement with various cultural groups.
* This role demands a unique blend of creativity, organizational skills, and adept communication skills, which are essential for addressing the local community while also fulfilling broader national objectives of inclusivity and economic development.

**Who You Are**

Our ideal candidate will be passionate about building vibrant public spaces and supporting businesses. You are creative, entrepreneurial, proactive, observant, well organized, and thrive in a fast\\-paced environment. You are passionate about our vision. You love brainstorming, problem\\-solving, and connecting with people. You’re often told by coworkers that they know something will get done if it gets passed to you, and you are not afraid to ask for support or clarification if needed. You have experience jumping in and putting processes in place that make an improvement on what has been built while being respectful of the work that has come before. You relish making sense of things, executing logistics, anticipating problems, and fixing them. You’re good at keeping information confidential and being tactful. You thrive on each day being different and working with our team on new opportunities and challenges. If you are organized, not easy to overwhelm, love details and you have a positive attitude that makes people want to be your teammate, we are looking forward to talking with you!

**Core Competencies:**

* Relevant post\\-secondary education; or a relevant combination of skills/qualifications
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
* Technologically adept and able to learn new software
* Excellent MS Office, primarily Excel and Word; Google Suite; and Zoom skills required
* Excellent interpersonal skills, customer service and persuasion
* Able to work with minimal supervision or in a team
* Able to work flexible hours to accommodate meeting attendance including some evenings and/or weekends
* Able to work in person and online

**Bonus Skills (Not Required):**

* Excellent verbal and written Mandarin, Korean, Cantonese OR Farsi

**Hours:** Contract (9 weeks); 30 hours/week; Possibility of Extension until Late August

**Wage:** $19/hour (semi\\-monthly pay periods)

**More Information:** www.yongenorthyork.com

**Other Requirements:**

Able to follow COVID\\-19 protocols when required including wearing a mask. Ability to interact positively with multiple individuals. Ability to traverse as a pedestrian and via TTC (fare provided) to visit member businesses in our area. Working home office wifi required in case of periodic remote work. Ability to lift 30lbs to assist with event set\\-up and prep.

This position is contingent on grant funding from the Federal Government. The candidate will be required to meet eligibility requirements for the Canada Summer Jobs Program including being between 15 and 30 years of age (inclusive) at the start of employment; a Canadian Citizen, permanent resident, or person on whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act; and legally entitled to work according to the relevant provincial / territorial legislation and regulations. International students are not eligible.

Job Types: Part\\-time, Fixed term contract, Internship / Co\\-op  
Contract length: 9\\-13 weeks

Pay: $19\\.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Ability to commute/relocate:

* North York, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

* Secondary School (required)

Experience:

* Event Planning or Operations: 1 year (preferred)
* Customer Service: 1 year (preferred)

Language:

* English (required)
* Mandarin, Cantonese or Farsi (preferred)
* Korean (preferred)

Work Location: In person

Application deadline: 2025\\-04\\-30  
Expected start date: 2025\\-05\\-20

title: Summer Camp Teacher
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a passionate and dedicated **Summer Camp Teacher** to join our educational team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating a positive and engaging learning environment that fosters both the intellectual and social development of children. This role involves planning and implementing exciting winter\\-themed lessons, assessing student progress, and collaborating with parents and staff to support each child's growth. The teacher will guide students through a variety of fun and educational activities during the winter camp program, while ensuring safety, inclusivity, and active participation.

**Duties**

* Develop and implement engaging Summer Camp lesson plans that meet the educational needs of students.
* Educate students in a variety of subjects, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of the curriculum, with a focus on winter activities and themes.
* Provide tutoring and additional support to students who may require extra assistance.
* Foster a nurturing and inclusive classroom environment that encourages participation, respect, and fun.
* Monitor and assess student progress, providing constructive feedback to students and parents as needed.
* Engage in continuous professional development to enhance teaching skills and methodologies.
* Collaborate with colleagues to develop camp\\-wide initiatives that promote early childhood education and create a memorable winter experience.
* Ensure the safety and well\\-being of all students during the camp activities.

**Experience**

* Previous experience working with children in an educational setting is preferred.
* A background in early childhood education (ECE) or as an Ontario Certified Teacher (OCT) is highly desirable.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively interact with students, parents, and staff.
* Ability to create engaging lesson plans that cater to diverse learning styles and developmental stages.
* Experience in tutoring or providing personalized educational support is a plus.
* A valid ECE or OCT license in Ontario is required.

Join us in making a difference in the lives of children through education and a fun, enriching March camp experience!

Job Type: Part\\-time

Pay: $16\\.55\\-$39\\.21 per hour

Expected hours: 16 – 40 per week

Work Location: In person
