title: RECE or Equivalent - Split Shift Position
description:
Upper Canada Child Care \\- “A smile on each child’s face…every day.”
  
  

We are currently recruiting Registered Early Childhood Educator(s) or equivalent (Child and Youth Worker or OCT Member) to join our Team in Keswick at the following location: Prince of Peace CES.
  
  

**Pay Rate:** $25\\.06 \\- $28\\.64/hour plus Wage Enhancement Grant ($2\\.00/hr), Split Shift Premium ($2\\.00/hr) \\& Canada Wide Early Learning \\& Child Care (up to $1\\.00/hr for RECEs where applicable)
  
  

* Candidates must be available to work a split shift in a before and after school program.


**Position Type \\& Required Availability:**  

* Full\\-time Split Shift Position (30 hours/week): Candidates must be available to work a split\\-shift (morning and afternoon) in our Before \\& After School programs Monday\\-Friday to be considered.


**Who We Are:**  

Upper Canada Child Care, non\\-profit licensed provider since 1983, operates 85\\+ centres in Toronto, York Region, and Simcoe County. We offer full\\-day and before and after school programs, summer camps, and a forest school. Guided by values of support, trust, safety, respect, and professionalism, we prioritize play\\-based learning and outdoor exploration. We invest in quality program delivery, providing specialized supports and training. Ministry of Education licensed, our programs reflect the four foundations of learning. Join us and help put “a smile on each child’s face…every day.”
  
  

**What We Offer Our Educators:**  

As a large and growing organization, we have the ability to offer competitive compensation and rewards, including regular pay increases, wage enhancement grants, paid personal days, medical and dental benefits, split shift premium pay, paid training and development, involvement in charity initiatives, long term service awards, childcare discounts, group RRSP program, formal mentorship program and the opportunity to advance and move throughout the organization. Upper Canada Child Care also operates summer day camps at select locations, in addition to unique programs such as residential camp and forest school.
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

To ensure operational and curriculum requirements are met while applying specialized skills and knowledge related to early childhood education. To deliver a developmentally appropriate, inquiry/play based program while ensuring compliance with all internal and external guidelines, policies and procedures. Supports the organization’s vision, mission, and guiding values. This is a fully in\\-centre position.
  
  

**Job Responsibilities:**  

* Applies professional knowledge of child development and current legislative expectations to support a program that is consistent with Ministry of Education requirements and in accordance with Upper Canada Child Care’s program statement.
* Adheres to the Code of Ethics and Standards of Practice as outlined by the Ontario College of Early childhood Educators (if applicable).
* Keeps team and supervisor apprised of compliance issues or problems related to governing regulation and internal policy.
* Engages with the children and provides a positive learning experience. Provides a range of care including assisting with meals/snacks, toileting, diapering, dressing, etc.
* Participates in professional development opportunities, staff meetings and training sessions as required.
* Completes program charts, daily logs, reports, and other administration tasks as required.
* Provides guidance to assistant educators, students and volunteers as needed.
* Models expectations for student teachers from colleges, universities, secondary schools, etc. Completes documentation from Educational Institutions as required.
* Fosters the engagement of and ongoing communication with parents about the program and their children. Attends parent and community meetings as needed.
* Uses Storypark for pedagogical documentation as a guide for program development.
* Effectively collaborates and communicates with other team members, school personnel, and outside agencies to help support the needs of all children.
* Identifies children in need of additional support. Guides parents through the process of accessing resources. Helps design and implement individual support plans as required.


**Qualifications and Requirements:**  

* Diploma or degree in Early Childhood Education (or approved equivalency) from a recognized college or university.
* A recent Police Vulnerable Sector Check.
* At least 18 years of age or older due to licensing requirements.
* Health assessment and up\\-to\\-date record of immunization as outlined by legislation.
* Up\\-to\\-date registration with the College of ECEs (if applicable).
* Up\\-to\\-date certification in CPR\\-C and Standard First Aid (training provided upon selection if required).
* Experience with inquiry/play based program design and implementation, and with the use of pedagogical documentation.
* Uses initiative; applies sound reason in solving problems and resolves conflict in a calm, professional manner.
* Proven ability to communicate (written and verbal) effectively and establish appropriate relationships with families, coworkers and other professionals.
* Have the physical and emotional stamina to effectively supervise children in a variety of settings including outdoor public spaces.
* Ability to use computer systems and programs; including Dayforce, and Storypark.
* Moderate level of physical effort is regularly required; including but not limited to kneeling, pushing, pulling, bending, and carrying.


Please apply by clicking on the available link, or email your resume to hr@ucccc.ca
  
  

Upper Canada Child Care is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and encourages applications from members of our diverse communities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact the interviewer in advance if you require accommodations.
  
  

Thank you for your interest; only applicants who may be interviewed will be contacted.
  
  

Don’t forget to check us out on Facebook, Instagram, “X” \\& LinkedIn!

title: Part Time School Bus Driver
description:
**No Experience? Love to Drive? Enjoy Working with Children? Need a Flexible Part\\-Time Schedule?**

If you answered Yes, to any of these questions, then Student Transportation of Canada might be the right place for you!

Elliott Coach Lines, a division of Student Transportation of Canada is looking for new and experienced School Bus Drivers. If you have a Class\\-B license, great! If you need help to get your Class\\-B, we will train you for **FREE!!!!!**

**What we Offer:**

* $22\\.20/hour
* Free license upgrades
* Monday to Friday schedule
* Holidays and Summer off
* Part\\-Time, Flexible Employment (15\\-20 hours per week)
* Make a positive difference in the lives of local children
* Bring your child on board, get paid and save on daycare!

**What do School Bus Drivers do???**

It's pretty simple, in the morning we pick up school aged passengers from predetermined locations and then deliver them to school. In the afternoon, we do the exact same thing, just in reverse order; we take them from school back home (once again at predetermined locations).

School Bus Drivers operate **Monday \\- Friday**, from September until the end of June...that's right, **summers off.** Depending upon your specific route, you could work anywhere from 7am \\-9:30am then again in the afternoon from about 2pm \\- 4pm.

**Who can do this job???**

As long as you are responsible adult and have at least a 'Class\\-G' drivers license, we can teach you how...for FREE!!!

* Looking for extra income?
* Recently retired?
* Uber/Lyft/Cab experience?
* or just curious...?

**Contact us today to get started**

Student Transportation of Canada is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you require a disability related accommodation to take part in our interview and selection process, or have any questions please reach out directly to a member of our Recruitment Team.

title: Summer Position - Learning and Development Coach
description:
**Now Hiring for Summer 2025: Summer Term Learning and Development Coach**  
**Location:** Melly’s Market \\+ Café \\| Pay: From $18\\.00/hour  
**Hours:** 35\\+ hours/week (Must be available Monday \\- Saturday)

Are you passionate about inclusion and excited to support adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities as they build confidence, learn new skills, and work toward their goals? Join us at **Melly’s Market \\+ Café** — a registered charity and social enterprise where community, great coffee, and personal growth come together.

Our café is open to the public and serves as a real\\-world training environment. Program participants rotate between the café, market, kitchen, and development room as part of our hands\\-on, skill\\-building program. As a Summer **Learning and Development Coach**, you’ll play a key role in helping our apprentices thrive in their journey toward greater independence and workplace success.

**You’ll love this role if you:**

* Enjoy teaching, training, or coaching others
* Thrive in dynamic environments where no two days are the same
* Are a natural communicator and “people person”
* Stay calm under pressure and bring a patient, positive attitude
* Are passionate about creating inclusive spaces and opportunities
* Take initiative, lead by example, and follow through
* Bonus points if you have a love for coffee!

This role is especially great for someone building a career in teaching, social work, disability support, or coaching/training.

**As a Learning and Development Coach, you will:**

* Become an expert on our menu and support participants in café tasks like drink\\-making, customer service, and POS operation
* Deliver customized training sessions using our **Interactive Workplace Program**
* Lead hands\\-on activities based on lesson plans — such as baking, merchandising, cleaning, and health \\& safety
* Provide consistent guidance, encouragement, and positive feedback
* Monitor progress and prepare daily reports for the Program Manager
* Support participants in developing both workplace and social/emotional skills
* Be a champion of inclusion and empowerment at every step of the program

Please note : This role is in partnership with Canada Summer Jobs and applicants must meet the following:

* Between 15 and 30 years of age at the start of the employment;
* Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of the employment
* Valid Social Insurance Number at the start of employment and legally entitled to work in Canada.

**Qualifications:**

· Experience working in a café or restaurant

· Proficient in use of Microsoft Office products

· A demonstrated history of work experience with team lead, supervisory, training or coaching responsibilities

**Assets (Not Required, but Nice to Have):**

* Experience or education in teaching, adult education, or developmental services
* Prior experience supporting individuals with intellectual or developmental disabilities
* Leadership experience in volunteer or paid roles
* Barista experience or coffee knowledge

**Additional Requirements:**

* A valid Ontario driver’s license and access to a vehicle as travel is required for this position
* Flexible hours / evenings / weekends may be required for this position.
* Background Check: A Police Vulnerable Sector is a requisite for this role.

*Qualified applicants are invited to submit their resume along with a cover letter detailing their experience and explaining why they are the ideal candidate for the Learning and Development Coach position at Melly's Workplace.* 

*Melly’s Workplace is an Equal Opportunity Employer.* 

*If you require accommodation in order to submit your application, please contact us at info@mellysworkplace.ca* 

*We embrace diversity and encourage all qualified candidates to apply.*

*To apply, please email your resume and a cover letter to info@mellysworkplace.ca.*

title: Youth Counsellor
description:
Youth Counsellor \\- 2 positions available

  



Employment Type:


* Full\\-Time, Fixed Term (1 FTE) \\- May 1, 2025 to August 30, 2025
* Full\\-Time, Fixed\\-Term (1 FTE – Maternity Leave Coverage, Approx. 12 Months)


Location: Bowmanville, Courtice, Newcastle



Shifts: Afternoons and Saturdays



Division: Clarington Youth Centres  

Employment Group: CUPE 2936\\.13



Salary: $23\\.85 per hour (with annual and anniversary increases)



Hours: 35 hours per week (Monday to Friday, occasional Saturday, with flexibility as needed)



Benefits: Accident, RRSP, Mileage

  

Estimated Start Dates:


* Full\\-Time, Fixed Term: May 1, 2025 to August 30, 2025
* Full\\-Time, Fixed\\-Term: April 28 2025 to April 24, 2026


Closing Date: April 30, 2025

  



About the Role



The Youth Counsellor plays an essential role in creating a safe, engaging, and supportive environment for youth (ages 12\\-19\\) within Clarington. Working alongside the Co\\-ordinator and program staff, this position is responsible for developing and implementing year\\-round after\\-school and summer programming that fosters social connections, confidence, and life skills.



Key responsibilities include:


* Engaging with youth to understand their needs and develop relevant programming.
* Leading youth centre activities alongside the Co\\-ordinator and contributing new ideas for program development.
* Collaborating with staff across locations to share best practices and achieve program goals.
* Creating a welcoming and supportive space where all youth feel valued.
* Participating in training and development opportunities to enhance professional skills.


The Clarington Youth Centres (CYC) include:


* The Loft – Courtice
* The Firehouse – Bowmanville
* NYC – Newcastle


Work hours are scheduled around youth centre operational hours, currently Tuesday to Saturday. Programming is based on five core pillars: Social \\& Leisure, Sports \\& Recreation, Life Skills, Creative Arts, and Volunteer \\& Civic Engagement.

  



Key Responsibilities



Youth Support \\& Development


* Use effective communication to guide and support youth in navigating challenges.
* Encourage emotional regulation, conflict resolution, and self\\-reflection.
* Serve as a positive role model while fostering a safe and respectful environment.
* Introduce engaging activities that allow youth to build confidence and explore new interests.
* Connect youth with community resources and peer support when needed.
* Maintain appropriate boundaries and confidentiality while ensuring safety.


Program \\& Community Engagement


* Plan, schedule, and implement programming based on youth interests and feedback.
* Build and maintain relationships with local schools and community partners.
* Promote programs through social media and community outreach initiatives.
* Support fundraising efforts to enhance programming.
* Maintain a clean, organized, and safe centre environment.


Qualifications \\& Skills



Education:


Post\\-secondary diploma/degree in Social Services, Child \\& Youth Work, or a related field.  

* 

Experience:


* Experience working with youth, including de\\-escalation and crisis intervention.
* Knowledge of youth programming trends and best practices.
* Strong ability to engage and support diverse youth populations.
* Recreation experience is an asset.


Skills:


* Creativity, flexibility, and enthusiasm for youth engagement.
* Strong communication, collaboration, and problem\\-solving abilities.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Additional Requirements:


* Class G driver’s license with appropriate 2 million liability insurance with the ability to transport youth.
* First Aid/CPR Certification (required).
* Crisis Intervention \\& ASIST Certifications (preferred).
* Satisfactory Police/Vulnerable Sector Check.


How to Apply



Submit a resume and cover letter highlighting your skills, experience, and passion for youth work through this link:

  


 https://jhsdurham.bamboohr.com/careers/408

  

About the John Howard Society of Durham Region



Our mission is to reduce the impact of crime and its causes by providing a spectrum of effective prevention and intervention programs.

  



We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in our hiring practices and workplace culture. If you require accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know in advance in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

  



Join us in making a difference in the lives of youth in Clarington!

title: Patio Server
description:
Are you passionate about wine, hospitality and tourism? Join us this season at ***Westcott Vineyards***, a family\\-run winery with a beautiful outdoor summer patio. We are looking to add friendly, outgoing\\_ **patio servers and hosts** \\_to our team. If you have an interest in or knowledge of wine, a love for food and wine pairings and enjoy providing excellent customer service with a friendly demeanor, we invite you to be a part of making this summer season truly exceptional.

This is a seasonal position starting in May.

***About Westcott***

Westcott Vineyards is a small boutique winery located in Jordan Station specializing in Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Sparkling wine. We are passionate about our land and truly believe great wine starts in the vineyard. Discussion of place and terroir is very important in our communication with customers. We aim to create a memorable and amazing customer experience through our passion for great wine and great conversations.

This role consists of but is not limited to:

* Communicating the Westcott story/brand to our guests in an enthusiastic and dynamic way
* Enthusiasm and passion for promoting wine sales \\& our wine club
* Prior serving experience is an asset
* Prior wine sales and retail experience is also an asset
* Table service of wine and food on our outdoor patio and lawn, carrying glassware on trays, setting and cleaning tables.
* Responsible for daily customer service operations, including greeting and serving guests, taking food and drinks orders, running food and drinks, and creating a welcoming atmosphere for guests.
* Using the Point\\-of\\-Service systems to communicate orders with the kitchen team
* Using the reservations system to seat guests and take/modify reservations.
* Carrying out pre\\- and post\\-service duties to maintain stock levels and an organized, clean environment.
* Attending pre\\-shift meetings and keeping up\\-to\\-date with winery events, i.e. wine club pick up days.

Qualifications:

* Excellent customer service skills
* Friendly and a team player
* Available to work weekends, evenings, and holidays
* Extensive wine knowledge isn’t necessary but an interest in learning about wine is
* Must be able to lift 40 lb cases of wine \\- Able to stand for long periods of time
* Professional attitude and a strong work ethic

Smart Serve certified and is 19\\+ years of age.

We thank everyone who applies and look forward to hearing from you! Please note we will only contact candidates who we wish to interview.

title: Customer Care and Sales Consultant
description:
**Job description**

Who are we?

We are every bride's favorite bridal shop! We pride ourselves on our personalized service, private suites and, a really fun atmosphere! Over the past 12 years, we have helped thousands of brides from all over the world find the wedding dress of their dreams. We are great listeners and have excellent ongoing training so we can show our gowns with pride and confidence. We are closed on Sundays and Mondays and on all long weekends in the summer. We offer flex hours that allow our staff to have a balanced home and work life.

Who are you?

You love the thrill of the sale, helping customers and exceeding sales targets. You are a fashionable, punctual, creative, happy and kind individual that loves interacting with people. No solitary cubicle for you! You are a self\\-starter and have an optimistic attitude about the tasks you face and are an excellent public speaker as well as an empathetic listener who can manage a group appointment as well as an individual one. You are great working in a team environment as you are kind and respectful to your team. You have an excellent phone manor and stay calm under pressure. You are very organized and have excellent attention to detail. Previous retail sales and customer service experience is considered an asset as well as post secondary education in Fashion or Business.

What is the position?

We are looking for a part\\-time retail sales/customer care professional with an outgoing and upbeat personality and phenomenal customer service for our Customer Care and Sales Consultant. The candidate will be expected to handle customer service inquiries (by phone, email and in person). You will also run bridal appointments and help brides find the dress of their dreams by providing information, showing them beautiful gowns and closing the sale. Just like on T.V's "Say Yes to the Dress"!You will assist the other staff with daily duties for the store when needed, between appointments. A professional who exceeds sales goals (by taking care of their clients) is preferred. This position will require availability on Tuesdays and Thursdays (4\\-8:30p.m) as well as all day Saturday . You will have all long weekends off and will receive your schedule 1 month at a time for easy planning. You will make an hourly wage plus tips and a store discount (great for our amazing jewelry!). You will get a raise review within 3 months.

Our ideal candidate will possess the following:

⦁ Minimum of one year experience in Women's Fashion Retail

⦁ Very personable and friendly

⦁ Excellent time management \\& problem solving skills

⦁ Efficient multi\\-tasking and conflict resolution skills

⦁ Comfortable speaking in front of a group

Is a great closer

Education:

Post secondary education in Business or Fashion is preferred but not required

This is a part\\-time position, with an hourly wage of $18\\.00 while training and after 3 month probation is completed, you will have a review and pay raise to $18\\.50 per hour. You will also receive tips as they become available, so the more you sell, the more you will make! You will be working an average of 12 hours per week but can range from 8 to 20 depending on traffic flow. You will work 3 days a week.

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* On\\-site parking
* Store discount
* full kitchen for lunch prep

Please answer the questions on Indeed, as this is the first step towards working with The Gown team!

Thank you

title: Customer Care and Sales Consultant
description:
**Job description**

Who are we?

We are every bride's favorite bridal shop! We pride ourselves on our personalized service, private suites and, a really fun atmosphere! Over the past 12 years, we have helped thousands of brides from all over the world find the wedding dress of their dreams. We are great listeners and have excellent ongoing training so we can show our gowns with pride and confidence. We are closed on Sundays and Mondays and on all long weekends in the summer. We offer flex hours that allow our staff to have a balanced home and work life.

Who are you?

You love the thrill of the sale, helping customers and exceeding sales targets. You are a fashionable, punctual, creative, happy and kind individual that loves interacting with people. No solitary cubicle for you! You are a self\\-starter and have an optimistic attitude about the tasks you face and are an excellent public speaker as well as an empathetic listener who can manage a group appointment as well as an individual one. You are great working in a team environment as you are kind and respectful to your team. You have an excellent phone manor and stay calm under pressure. You are very organized and have excellent attention to detail. Previous retail sales and customer service experience is considered an asset as well as post secondary education in Fashion or Business.

What is the position?

We are looking for a part\\-time retail sales/customer care professional with an outgoing and upbeat personality and phenomenal customer service for our Customer Care and Sales Consultant. The candidate will be expected to handle customer service inquiries (by phone, email and in person). You will also run bridal appointments and help brides find the dress of their dreams by providing information, showing them beautiful gowns and closing the sale. Just like on T.V's "Say Yes to the Dress"!You will assist the other staff with daily duties for the store when needed, between appointments. A professional who exceeds sales goals (by taking care of their clients) is preferred. This position will require availability on Tuesdays and Thursdays (4\\-8:30p.m) as well as all day Saturday . You will have all long weekends off and will receive your schedule 1 month at a time for easy planning. You will make an hourly wage plus tips and a store discount (great for our amazing jewelry!). You will get a raise review within 3 months.

Our ideal candidate will possess the following:

⦁ Minimum of one year experience in Women's Fashion Retail

⦁ Very personable and friendly

⦁ Excellent time management \\& problem solving skills

⦁ Efficient multi\\-tasking and conflict resolution skills

⦁ Comfortable speaking in front of a group

Is a great closer

Education:

Post secondary education in Business or Fashion is preferred but not required

This is a part\\-time position, with an hourly wage of $18\\.00 while training and after 3 month probation is completed, you will have a review and pay raise to $18\\.50 per hour. You will also receive tips as they become available, so the more you sell, the more you will make! You will be working an average of 12 hours per week but can range from 8 to 20 depending on traffic flow. You will work 3 days a week.

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* On\\-site parking
* Store discount
* full kitchen for lunch prep

Please answer the questions on Indeed, as this is the first step towards working with The Gown team!

Thank you

Job Types: Part\\-time, Permanent

Pay: From $18\\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 8 – 20 per week

Additional pay:

* Tips

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* On\\-site parking
* Store discount

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Weekends as needed

title: Associate Veterinarian
description:
***DVM Opportunities That Let You Live Where Others Vacation***

*Ontario's playground awaits: a region where pristine lakes, island\\-dotted Georgian Bay, and endless forests create the backdrop for your daily practice. We represent clinics throughout Muskoka Kawartha Lakes and Georgian Bay where you can build a meaningful career without sacrificing the lifestyle that draws millions of visitors every year.*

*"I spent years treating pets whose owners would tell me about their amazing cottage weekends. Now I live and practice where they vacation, and my 'weekend getaway' is my everyday life." \\- DVM who traded GTA burnout for Cottage Country fulfillment*

***Our Cottage Country Portfolio Features:***

* *Practices ranging from Barrie to Parry Sound to Bancroft, and the communities in between*
* *Clinics that understand seasonal fluctuations and staff accordingly (summer busy season won't break your spirit)*
* *Teams where experience is valued and mentorship is genuine*

***Cottage Country Lifestyle Benefits:***

* *Housing that's more affordable than the GTA (with waterfront possibilities actually within reach)*
* *Four\\-season recreation literally at your doorstep: boating, swimming, hiking, skiing, snowmobiling*
* *Small\\-town community with surprising cultural richness and Toronto just a couple hours away when needed*

***Who We're Looking For:***

* *We love working with fully licensed DVMs who appreciate both professional excellence and quality of life.*
* *You're adaptable to the seasonal rhythm of cottage country practice, comfortable building relationships with both year\\-round residents and seasonal visitors, and genuinely enjoy the pace of smaller community medicine.*
* *The ideal candidate values outdoor lifestyle, brings a collaborative approach to practice, and understands that in these communities, you're treating family members, not just pets.*

***Ready to wake up to misty lakes instead of traffic jams?*** *Send your CV to hello@goodvet.ca with a note about what draws you to Cottage Country living. Water enthusiast? Forest explorer? Four\\-season adventurer? Your personal interests help us match you with a practice where you'll thrive professionally while enjoying the natural playground that millions only get to visit briefly.*

*Goodvet is a Canadian owned and operated veterinary hiring support that matches fully licensed veterinary professionals with stellar independently owned practices through a relationship\\-first approach.*

Check out our other opportunities across Canada at

\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-\\-

***A Year in Cottage Country Practice***

***Summer Season (Peak):*** *The practice hums with activity as seasonal residents and tourists flood the region. You'll treat everything from boat accident injuries to wildlife encounters, all while knowing that after your shift, you can be on your own dock or hiking trail within minutes. The pace is brisk but manageable because our practices plan for the summer surge.*

***Fall Season (Shoulder):*** *As the leaves turn spectacular colors, the pace eases slightly. You'll enjoy a mix of year\\-round residents and weekenders, with more time to build client relationships. The region's beauty takes on a new dimension, and you'll have time to actually enjoy those fall hikes and harvest festivals.*

***Winter Season (Off\\-Peak):*** *Practice shifts to primarily serving year\\-round residents, with a focus on wellness care and scheduled procedures. The community feels more intimate, and you become part of the fabric of winter life—whether that means snowshoeing, skating on frozen lakes, or enjoying the quiet beauty that tourists rarely see.*

***Spring Season (Renewal):*** *As the region awakens, you'll experience the unique joy of watching cottage country come back to life. The practice begins to pick up again, but there's still time to enjoy spring fishing, early season boating, and trail exploration before the summer crowds return.*

***The Real Scoop on Cottage Country Practice***

***The Undeniable Advantages:***

* *Living in one of Ontario's most beautiful regions all year round*
* *Building wealth through more affordable real estate and lower cost of living*
* *Developing genuine long\\-term relationships with year\\-round clients*
* *Practicing true community medicine where your role is valued and visible*
* *The mental health benefits of daily access to nature and water*

***The Honest Realities:***

* *Seasonal fluctuations require adaptability (busy summers, quieter winters)*
* *Some specialty services require referral to larger centers*
* *Fewer big\\-city amenities (though more than you might expect)*
* *Winter driving skills are non\\-negotiable*
* *A smaller pool of professional peers compared to urban centers*

***The Unexpected Delights:***

* *Treating the pet of someone who later serves you at the local restaurant or helps you at the hardware store*
* *The genuine gratitude from a community that values having quality veterinary care nearby*
* *Combining work and pleasure (like taking the boat to work in summer)*
* *The deep sense of belonging that comes from being part of a tight\\-knit community*
* *The daily reminder that you're living where others save all year to visit*

*At Goodvet, we understand that Ontario’s Cottage Country offers unique veterinary opportunities. The practices we represent provide competitive compensation (often with production bonuses), genuine work\\-life balance, and connection to communities that truly value veterinary care. If trading urban stress for lake\\-view sunsets sounds appealing, email your CV to hello@goodvet.ca and let's start the conversation.*

* unrestricted license issued by the CVO? (required)

title: Summer Childcare Cook
description:
Who we are:

Greenlane Montessori School is a new and unique facility where Montessori education paves the way for a nurturing, caring and warm learning milieu. We at Greenlane Montessori believe that all children should grow and develop in a creative environment, where they are free to discover their own unique skills at their own pace! Our school offers multiple activities and programs at the child’s grasp to develop and enhance new and existing skills from math, language, science, art, music, fine motor, sensory, zoology, French and much more to explore.

Greenlane Montessori is seeking highly committed and passionate Montessori Certified Teachers and RECEs who will be responsible for educating, stimulating, influencing, and caring for the children in their classroom environment in accordance with the values and mission statement of Ashwood Glen school. Age Group Precasa (16m\\-2\\.5yrs), Casa (2\\.5yrs\\-4yrs) and Kindercasa (4yrs\\-6yrs).

Full Job Description:

**The cook is responsible for duties relating to the preparation and serving of snacks and meals. The cook is responsible for general cleaning, maintenance and housekeeping of the kitchen and the Centre as needed. The position includes administration tasks such as daily logs and records as well as Grocery shopping and preparing order list. The cook may assist with supervision of the children when deemed necessary and appropriate.**

**SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE**

* A recent **Vulnerable Sector Check** (less than 6 month)
* Health assessment and up\\-to\\-date record of immunization as outlined by legislation.
* Up\\-to\\-date certification in **CPR\\-C and Standard First Aid** (training available upon selection if required).
* **Food Handler Certification**
* **Valid Driver’s Licence and reliable vehicle.**
* Experience in food preparation and serving.
* Ability to operate standard kitchen appliances and laundry equipment.
* Prior experience working with children an asset.
* Knowledge of Canada’s Food Guide.
* Effective communication skills.
* Have the physical stamina and ability to kneel, bend, lift and stand for extended periods.

Thank you for your interest; only applicants who may be interviewed will be contacted.

Job Types: Full\\-time, Part\\-time

Pay: $19\\.00\\-$20\\.00 per hour

Benefits:

* On\\-site childcare
* On\\-site parking

Flexible language requirement:

* French not required

Experience:

* Cooking: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

* Food Safe, SafeCheck, Food Handler or equivalent (required)

description:

Canada Summer Student Job

June 16, 2025

Overlea Blvd

May 16, 2025, by 5:00 pm EST

Please include a cover letter and resume in a single file. Qualified applicants are invited to submit their applications online:

www.jobillico.com/en/job\\-offer/flemingdon\\-health\\-centre/canada\\-summer\\-student\\-job/15664444

**Background:** Flemingdon Health Centre (FHC) is an engaged and involved member of some of Toronto’s most dynamic neighborhoods; Flemingdon Park, Fairview and Thorncliffe Park. FHC is a registered charity and an incorporated not\\-for\\-profit Community Health Centre (CHC), with a vision of Strong Healthy Communities. Across our three sites, we provide a range of health\\-related services based on the social determinants of health with extensive community engagement.

Position Summary:

At Flemingdon Health Centre (FHC), we are excited to participate in the Canada Summer Jobs (CSJ) Program, offering meaningful paid summer job opportunities for youth to gain valuable work experience in the healthcare and community services sector.

As a Canada Summer Student, you will support a variety of projects and day\\-to\\-day operations across several teams. These roles offer students hands\\-on exposure to real\\-world tasks in a collaborative, professional, and community\\-focused environment. This summer, we are hiring for the following departments:

Summer Job Opportunities at FHC

**1\\. Population Health \\& Wellness Team (Youth Violence Prevention Program)**

· Support youth engagement and violence prevention initiatives

· Assist with program coordination, workshops, and outreach efforts

**2\\. Health Access Thorncliffe Park (HATP)**

· Support community health programming and client services

· Assist with organizing events, workshops, and communications

**3\\. Primary Care Team**

· Provide clinical and administrative support

· Assist with data entry, educational materials, and patient coordination

**4\\. Chronic Disease \\& Mental Health (CD\\&MH) Team**

· Assist with program delivery and communications for health initiatives

· Share administrative responsibilities and support various health programs

What We Offer at FHC:

· Hands\\-on experience in a healthcare and community services setting

· Exposure to health promotion, admin, client services, and more

· Mentorship and professional guidance from experienced staff

· Opportunities to network and enhance your resume

· A safe, inclusive, and supportive workplace culture

Skills \\& Qualifications:

· Post\\-secondary education in social services, health, administration, or a related field (preferred)

· Eagerness to learn and contribute in a team setting

· Respectful, adaptable, and compassionate approach to working with diverse communities

· Excellent communication and organizational skills

· Must provide a current Vulnerable Sector Police Check

Eligibility – Canada Summer Jobs Criteria:

· Must be between 15 and 30 years old at the start of employment

· Must be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or have official refugee status in Canada

· Must have a valid Social Insurance Number (SIN)

· International students are not eligible

Why Work with Us?

At FHC, we’re more than a workplace—we’re a community. Join us this summer and:

· Gain valuable professional experience

· Work in a diverse and mission\\-driven organization

· Build skills that will support your future career in health or community services

*We encourage applications from individuals who can identify with the diverse communities we serve. We thank all applicants for their interest but regret that only those selected for an interview will receive an acknowledgement. Please note that a criminal background check (Vulnerable sector) will be conducted for this position. In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.*

title: Buyer, Integrated Investments
description:
Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
\\|
Agency: UM \\- Canada
Ref\\#: 16771
\\|
Job Function: Investment
\\|
Type of Contract: Regular **Position Summary:**



The role of a Buyer, Investment is to prepare, negotiate and document the execution of client’s media buys within their buying group, as well as prepare or assist the Supervisor/Manager in preparing all written documentation for the Planner or Client (e.g.: pre\\-buy/post\\-buy reports, media evaluations/recommendations, and other pertinent documentation).



This role requires you to work as part of an integrated media investment team to ensure the product is grounded in insights and experience, resulting in flawless media executions.

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Negotiate media campaigns directly with sales representatives.


* Purchase all assigned media to campaign parameters.


* Request submissions for upcoming campaigns from media partners.


* Develop a media schedule that satisfies campaign parameters and brand objectives.


* In partnership with the media planning team address market concerns, timing, and brand attribution.


* Prepare and present pre\\-buy and post\\-buy reports.


* Upload media buys and track changes with a high level of accuracy.


* Responsible for solving and clearing billing discrepancies/queries, and managing the budget control report (BCR) in a timely manner.


* Execute all relevant revisions to the media buy.


* Negotiate compensation as required.


* Ensure clear communication with the planning teams (e.g. involvement in briefs).


* Assist the Senior Buyer on the evaluation or cost value analysis of sponsorships and integrations and make recommendations where appropriate.


* Explore promotional or value\\-added opportunities where applicable.


* Proactively advise the team of any variations to execution of media plans.


* Assist with training junior employees on tools and processes.


* Assist with the preparation of media point of views (POVs).


* Prepare market analyses.


* Conduct third party audits as required.


* Continue to proactively develop knowledge of the media landscape.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Professional or Educational background in Marketing or Advertising would give leverage to this application.


* Associate level of experience within the media industry with proven buying experience.


* Driven desire to develop and excel in a media career.


* Client service oriented.


* Professional analytical and financial acumen.


* Professional learning agility, with a passion for continuous development.


* Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal).


* Highly developed organizational skills with professional attention to detail and accuracy.


* Excellent ability to manage and prioritize time effectively.


* Proactive approach to problem solving, assisting the team, self\\-development, etc.


* Ability to work collaboratively as well as independently.


* Ability to negotiate effectively.


* Ability to develop and foster relationships with media partners.


* Proficient with media research tools.


* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).

  



UM is a global media agency committed to Futureproofing our clients’ businesses for the now and the next. We leverage the transformational power of rich business analytics and real\\-time intelligence to maximize growth and activate the full consumer journey across content and connections. Our consultative approach and agile model, rooted in diversity, equity and belonging, drive better business outcomes for brands. As the leading global media network in Mediabrands, UM operates in over 100 countries, with more than 3,000 people innovating on a roster of clients including the following in Canada: BMO, Sobeys, PokerStars, FanDuel, Johnson \\& Johnson, SkipTheDishes, Sony, Spotify and Hershey. UM is the number one agency in Canada, as ranked by RECMA, and the most awarded media agency at the Media Innovation Awards and CMA Awards for the past two years. For more information, please visit umww.ca.


**What's in it for you?**  

* Generous paid time off with a minimum of 37 paid days off including vacation and monthly wellness days. We also have four\\-day long weekends, half\\-day summer Fridays, and meeting\\-free Friday afternoons year\\-round.
* A flexible hybrid work model that works for you.
* A focus on personal development with formal training opportunities, including mental health training and inclusion education for everyone.
* A chance to be part of and grow within a global network of agencies.
* The opportunity to contribute to our company culture by joining one of our many community\\-based employee groups, such as Black Employee Network, Girls on Fire, Hispanic or Latinx Alliance, Neuro Network, Pan\\-Asian Network, and Rainbow Lounge.


UM is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, colour, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, creed, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, provincial, or municipal law. If you require an accommodation in any aspect of the selection process, please reach out to canadatalent@mbww.com.

title: Transportation Planner - Summer Student
description:
407 ETR Summer Student Program: Building Futures Together
At 407 ETR, we are committed to providing meaningful work experiences that empower early career professionals from underrepresented and marginalized groups. Our Summer Student Program is designed to support your growth, enhance your resume, and pave the way for a successful career.
About the Program:* Purpose: Our program aims to bridge the gap between education and professional life. As a summer student, you’ll gain hands\\-on experience, learn from industry experts, and contribute to real\\-world projects.
* Eligibility Criteria:
	+ Underrepresented Group: We encourage candidates who have identified themselves as part of an underrepresented or marginalized group to apply.
	+ Age Requirement: Applicants must be 18 years of age or older.
	+ Enrollment: You are currently enrolled as a full\\-time student at a post\\-secondary institution (college or university).
	+ Proof of Enrollment: You will need to provide proof of enrollment that you are a full\\-time post\\-secondary student.
	+ Availability: You must be available Monday through Friday during business hours from May to August.

Position Summary:
The Transportation Planner Co\\-op Role will report directly to the Manager of Traffic \\& Planning, and will assume responsibility for preparing traffic and planning reports, as well as generating data\\-driven insights through the processing, modelling, analysis, and interpretation of transportation, mobility, and spatial datasets.
Position Responsibility:* Prepare and serve as an advisor for traffic reports to senior management and shareholders, including daily traffic summaries, monthly management reports, and quarterly traffic summaries.
* Utilize state\\-of\\-the\\-art Location Based Services datasets, including Inrix, Streetlight Data, and others, to research traffic mobility trends and metrics with a special focus on the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area.
* Prepare presentation materials as required for all areas of responsibility.
* Support transportation forecasting network demand model and run analysis of network and land use scenarios as necessary.
* Assist in the preparation of the 407ETR Annual Highway Safety Review to support Highway Operations safety reporting, identify areas for improvement.
* Review and assess traffic impact studies and developments affecting the 407ETR corridor and prepares reports with recommendations to the Manager and Senior Planner.
* Undertakes, coordinates and reviews studies, research projects and data analysis as required relating to transportation in the region.


Qualifications:* Studies in Transportation Planning, Urban Geography, and/or Transportation Technology.
* Familiarity with Tableau and other Business Intelligence Data Management Software.
* Familiarity with travel demand forecasting (EMME) is preferable.
* Capabilities in GIS and graphical applications are an asset.
* Well\\-developed research and problem\\-solving skills.
* Strong communication skills and a strong work ethic.
* Ability to interact with colleagues in a positive manner within a self\\-managed team structure.


Why Choose 407 ETR:* Inclusive Environment: We foster an inclusive workplace where diversity is celebrated. Your unique perspective matters to us.
* Mentorship: Our experienced professionals will guide you, helping you develop skills that will serve you well throughout your career.
* Impactful Projects: Contribute to projects that matter. Your work will directly influence our operations and community.
* 407 ETR Usage: The highway is a taxable benefit which is provided to associates to get to and from work.


Selection Criteria:* Returning Students: We value continuity. Returning students will be considered for the program.
* Outreach Program: Our collaboration with the registrar’s office at post\\-secondary educational institutions ensures that this program serves as an outreach opportunity.
* Career Reflection: As part of the interview process, we’ll ask you to reflect on what you hope to gain from this opportunity and how it aligns with your career path.


Application Process:  

Ready to embark on this exciting journey? Visit our website to learn more about the 407 ETR Summer Student Program and submit your application. Let’s build futures together!
About 407 ETR
Highway 407 ETR is an all\\-electronic open\\-access toll highway located in the Greater Toronto Area in Ontario, Canada. The highway spans 108 kilometres from Burlington in the west to Pickering in the east.
407 International Inc. is the sole shareholder of 407 ETR and is owned by:* Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments) through indirectly\\-owned subsidiaries (50\\.01%);
* Cintra Global S.E. which is a wholly\\-owned subsidiary of Ferrovial S.A. (43\\.23%); and
* AtkinsRéalis, formally known as SNC\\-Lavalin (6\\.76%).


Note: *At 407 ETR, we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment. We value the unique perspectives and backgrounds of all individuals, and we firmly believe that our individual differences make us stronger as a whole.**Our commitment to inclusion extends beyond recruitment and encompasses an inclusive workplace culture through raising awareness, ongoing training, and encouraging feedback. We aim to create a safe and supportive environment where all employees can thrive.**Accommodation for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.*

title: Intern
description:
**DESCRIPTION**


Acosta Group Canada is seeking career driven students to join us this summer as Field Sales Representatives with our Acosta Summer Paid Internship program. Acosta can offer hands on experience in today’s work force in skills such as sales, negotiation techniques, effective problem solving, business relationships and presentation/communication skills. This valuable experience can grow into career possibilities like permanent Team Lead, District Manager, Trainer, or Account Manager.


As an intern with our Acosta Summer Paid Internship you’ll be working full time hours between Monday to Friday from May to August. No evening or weekend work! This opportunity will offer you direct experience with our top sales representatives and merchandisers to learn about territory management, retail execution and building client relationships.


Why Acosta Group Canada stands out in the competition:


We are a North American Integrated Marketing Agency. We use our collective creativity to drive commerce, conversion, and brand affinity. Our core company values shape our behavior. We are proud to offer a culture that is inclusive, responsible, and empowering. Be a part of a large corporation of good citizens that contribute to our local communities through "giving back" initiatives. Our “Think Before You Ink” campaign is just one of the many ways that our employees strive towards more sustainable practices to save our planet.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Competitive wage
* Mentorship program with leaders in our company to grow your skills
* Referral bonus program for any family and friends that want to join our team
* Extensive industry knowledge on brands you interact with every day
* Employee recognition for professional achievements
* A company that offers room for growth and internal opportunities to expand your career
* Continual education through our internal Leadership Development Program and LinkedIn Learning.

**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Be a current or recent grad of a Canadian college or university
* Be available for shifts between Monday – Friday from May – August (possibility of extension)
* Have a reliable vehicle and driver's license
* Be able to lift 30\\-50 lbs.

**ABOUT US**


Acosta Group is a collective uniting the most trusted retail, marketing, and foodservice agencies—Acosta, ActionLink, CORE Foodservice, CROSSMARK, Mosaic, Premium Retail Services, and Product Connections. Together, we connect consumers with the brands they love through omnichannel selling, merchandising, brand advocacy, and integrated marketing.


We recognize our associates are the foundation of our success. That’s why we prioritize your growth, development, and well\\-being to help you reach your full potential. With programs designed to support a fulfilling work\\-life balance, we offer opportunities that fit your lifestyle and ambitions—whether you’re looking for part\\-time flexibility or full\\-time career advancement.


Ready for a career path that’s as unique as you? Discover your path at Acosta Group!


We empower you to Discover Your Path and fully embrace BEING YOU as you shape your journey with us. At Acosta Group, we value equal opportunity in employment practices and career progression. Employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications without regard to race/ethnicity, gender/gender identity, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, and local laws. Acosta Group will provide reasonable accommodations for applicants with physical or mental disabilities to complete applications or interviews for employment. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact **EmployeeServices@acosta.com**


Acosta Group and its subsidiaries believe the posted compensation range accurately reflects this role at the time of posting. Final pay may vary based on qualifications and location, and the range may be updated in the future.


Acosta Group is an E\\-Verify employer. By applying, you agree to our Privacy Statement and Terms of Conditions.


US: http://acosta.jobs/privacy\\-policy\\-us/


Canada: http://acosta.jobs/privacy\\-policy\\-ca/


Acosta, and its subsidiaries, is an Equal Opportunity Employer


**Job Category:** Administration


**Position Type:** Full time


**Business Unit:** Sales


**Salary Range:** $40,000\\.00 \\- $40,000\\.00


**Company:** Acosta Services Canada Co


**Req ID:** 5543

title: Camp Counselor Summer 2025 (Sewing)
description:
**Job description**

We are looking for energetic camp counselors to be the **Sewing Camp Instructors** at 4 of our locations in Mississauga and Oakville. The most important Camp Counselor's responsibility is to ensure campers are always safe. You’ll be responsible for positively leading and overseeing their activities and ensuring they don’t get lost or hurt while creating a fun and inclusive atmosphere.

The counselor will lead a group of campers \\& direct a staff member in the sewing camps. The sewing camps rotate through our locations, one week at a time to as many as 4 locations, and the counselor will rotate to each location with an exclusive focus on leading the sewing camp. Must have a car available to ensure on\\-time transportation to each location.

In addition to the sewing camp, counselors will supervise a group of kids in outdoor play activities and on a Field Trip outing that includes supervising bus transportation.

Counselors report to a Team Leader /Site Supervisor at their location

**Summary of Role** 

The role of the Sewing Camp Councillor is to directly supervise and support your camper group during their stay with us. This will require a lot of personal focus and energy as well as close collaboration with fellow staff and the Team Leader to be successful.

The daily goal of the Sewing Camp Councillor is to ensure camper safety while fostering a fun and inclusive atmosphere to enjoy their selected activities. Campers should feel safe and welcome as they learn and grow through their activities and interactions with other campers and staff.

Staff should feel valued and supported in their role as they serve campers' needs. Counselors should be proficient in the activities they lead and try to improve as the camp progresses, but the focus is on the child overall needs.

Counselors also supervise their groups in outdoor play activities and on Field Trip outings that include supervising bus transportation and at the Field trip venue.

Counselors report to a Team Leader /Site Supervisor at their location

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

Supervising campers and ensuring their safety in all settings, whether indoors, outdoors, or on field trips. This includes administering first aid to campers as needed and producing accurate incident reports.

Planning and implementing Sewing Camp activities. Daily Preparation of materials before the start of the activity, managing the group during the activity, and resetting the materials and the camper space after the activity

Teach specific sewing skills and execute the assigned projects. **Specific Sewing skills required include:** 

Initial setup of the sewing equipment so it's functional and safe and safe, secure pack up of the equipment at the end of the camp. Creative Kids Place will transport the equipment to each site weekly.

Teach a group of up to 10 camper basic skills \\& then progress to projects

Strong focus on safety in all aspects of the activity

Ability to manage the group and meet their needs individually

show kids how to thread a sewing machine, how to sew, and how to wind a bobbin and replace needles when they break and unjam the machines

Pattern work; Tracing \\& cutting.

Projects include making aprons, tote bags, backpacks, stuffies, pillows, water bottle holders, pajama bottoms, and more.

Guide the group through the daily schedule, including material preparation, transitioning between core activities, managing the lunch period, and overseeing outside play activities while maintaining a clean area/section, as well as managing Field Trip outings.

Discussing camper participation and concerns with parents and other camp staff members daily as required. The Team Leader can support councillors with parent/guardian conversations.

Assist with Check\\-In/Check\\-Out as needed.

Help manage the Lost and Found at the end of each day.

Provide consistent leadership to foster positive group interactions.

Create and nurture a safe, fun, and inclusive environment for all campers. Resolve occasional fights between children fairly and address behavioral issues as they arise.

Resolve conflicts positively and fairly among campers.

Safely supervise and guide a group of children during weekly Field Trip outings, including safe bus loading, travel, unloading, and group movement at the site.

Follow the Site Supervisor's directions and work collaboratively within a team structure, both offering and accepting help as needed.

**Duties, Qualifications, and Skills** 

**Duties** 

Should be available for the entire camp period Monday to Friday for assigned hours

**Qualifications**

2 Mandatory paid staff training days hosted by Creative Kids Place before camp

A minimum of 1 year of proven previous camp experience is an asset

Completion of 2 years of a college or University program preferred

Level 3 \\- Vulnerable Sector Check to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted. This is a condition of employment.

Must have a valid First Aid/CPR level C certificate in place by the start of camp

Must have completed at least 1 year of university or college studies

Should make available 2 references with email and phone contacts

Ability to meet the physical demands of the job (strength and stamina to follow strenuous activities like hiking, running, crouching, or carrying children)

**Skills** 

Should have teamwork and collaboration mindset and skills

Strong planning \\& organizational skills with the ability to be flexible as needed

Should have problem\\-solving skills to resolve issues for camper and staff issues

Should enjoy interacting with campers from ages 4 to 12

Must be patient and be comfortable working in a busy, loud \\& hectic setting

**Work Conditions, Salary \\& Schedule \\& Location**

**Work Conditions**

Air conditioning at all locations except the Auditorium at Streetsville.

Stand/Walking for long periods

Weekly Bus and Field Trip

Minimum 1 hour daily outdoor periods with campers

30\\-minute lunch break. 2 x 15\\-minute breaks should be arranged with the manager

Lunch may need to be enjoyed with the children to ensure supervision. Not all locations have a staff room.

Must be patient and be comfortable working in a busy, loud \\& hectic setting

**Salary \\& Schedule \\& Location**

**Starting salary:** $18\\.50 per hour based on experience, qualifications

**Schedule:**

Start date July 7, 2025, to August 22, 2025

Must attend paid staff training days before Camp

Full\\-time Contract 7 weeks

8\\-hour shift day shift

Monday to Friday

No evening or weekend work is required

**Work Location:** **In person**

Mississauga West \\- 3195 The College Way Mississauga

Streetsville United Church\\- 274 Queen St S. Mississauga

Sheridan College Square One – 4180 Duke of York Blvd. Mississauga

Sheridan College Oakville – 1430 Trafalgar Road Oakville

title: Event Planner
description:
Yonge North York Business Improvement Area (BIA) serves 1600 member businesses and commercial property owners in the area along Yonge between the 401 and Bishop Avenue. Our vision is to be the preferred destination in North Toronto for businesses, residents, visitors and workers to live, work and play. Assisting our members and delivering relevant support is a priority.

**Reports to:** Executive Director and Marketing \\& Economic Development Manager

**Key Accountabilities**

* Integral to orchestrating a variety of community events, including popular summer food festivals, cultural happenings, and winter holiday celebrations.
* Actively engages the public and works collaboratively with local businesses to promote participation, with a special focus on newcomers, youth, and seniors, aligning with local priorities.
* The diverse cultural backdrop of the area is showcased through these events, offering a variety of experiences to the community. In addition to supporting seasonal festivals, the planner is tasked with developing new event concepts that contribute to local economic growth and specifically cater to targeted groups, in line with both local and national priorities.
* Involves a range of responsibilities, from creating promotional materials, acting as an ambassador for the organization at events and managing logistics to implementing media and marketing efforts. Essential to this position is the ability to work weekends and communicate effectively in one or more languages prevalent in the community, such as Korean, Mandarin, or Cantonese, or Farsi, enhancing inclusivity and engagement with various cultural groups.
* This role demands a unique blend of creativity, organizational skills, and adept communication skills, which are essential for addressing the local community while also fulfilling broader national objectives of inclusivity and economic development.

**Who You Are**

Our ideal candidate will be passionate about building vibrant public spaces and supporting businesses. You are creative, entrepreneurial, proactive, observant, well organized, and thrive in a fast\\-paced environment. You are passionate about our vision. You love brainstorming, problem\\-solving, and connecting with people. You’re often told by coworkers that they know something will get done if it gets passed to you, and you are not afraid to ask for support or clarification if needed. You have experience jumping in and putting processes in place that make an improvement on what has been built while being respectful of the work that has come before. You relish making sense of things, executing logistics, anticipating problems, and fixing them. You’re good at keeping information confidential and being tactful. You thrive on each day being different and working with our team on new opportunities and challenges. If you are organized, not easy to overwhelm, love details and you have a positive attitude that makes people want to be your teammate, we are looking forward to talking with you!

**Core Competencies:**

* Relevant post\\-secondary education; or a relevant combination of skills/qualifications
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
* Technologically adept and able to learn new software
* Excellent MS Office, primarily Excel and Word; Google Suite; and Zoom skills required
* Excellent interpersonal skills, customer service and persuasion
* Able to work with minimal supervision or in a team
* Able to work flexible hours to accommodate meeting attendance including some evenings and/or weekends
* Able to work in person and online

**Bonus Skills (Not Required):**

* Excellent verbal and written Mandarin, Korean, Cantonese OR Farsi

**Hours:** Contract (9 weeks); 30 hours/week; Possibility of Extension until Late August

**Wage:** $19/hour (semi\\-monthly pay periods)

**More Information:** www.yongenorthyork.com

**Other Requirements:**

Able to follow COVID\\-19 protocols when required including wearing a mask. Ability to interact positively with multiple individuals. Ability to traverse as a pedestrian and via TTC (fare provided) to visit member businesses in our area. Working home office wifi required in case of periodic remote work. Ability to lift 30lbs to assist with event set\\-up and prep.

This position is contingent on grant funding from the Federal Government. The candidate will be required to meet eligibility requirements for the Canada Summer Jobs Program including being between 15 and 30 years of age (inclusive) at the start of employment; a Canadian Citizen, permanent resident, or person on whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act; and legally entitled to work according to the relevant provincial / territorial legislation and regulations. International students are not eligible.

Contract length: 9\\-13 weeks

* Weekends as needed

title: Associate Software Developer (SpedTrack)
description:
**The Opportunity**

  


The Associate Developer is responsible for developing, testing, and maintaining front\\-end user interfaces. This individual will focus primary on front end with HTML, however, experience with C\\# and .Net are valuable for growth into a full stack developer. Software developers contribute to their team’s success through the effective execution of engineering processes and best practices and continuously improving their own skillset.

 **Responsibilities**


* Develop and test web applications using HTML, CSS, C\\#, .NET, JavaScript, SQL, and other related tools.
* Participate in code reviews.
* Collaborate with senior developers, product managers, designers, and clients to understand requirements and deliver secure, scalable, and performant solutions
* Troubleshoot and debug issues in existing applications and provide technical support.
* Write clean, maintainable, and well\\-documented code following best practices and standards.
* Design and write test automation scripts to maintain a healthy application.
* Stay up to date with the new technologies, frameworks, and industry trends. Share this knowledge with team members.
* Become knowledgeable with our software products including the benefits and business proposition they provide to our customers.
* Demonstrate self\\-motivation and the ability to stay productive while working either independently or as part of team projects.
* Demonstrate commitment to our core values and team environment.

  


**Qualifications**


* Preferred 1\\+ years building and shipping production web applications.
* Earned minimum of associate degree (bachelor preferred) in Computer Science, Software Development, or equivalent.
* Must be open to learning from feedback given in code reviews and taking direction from more senior developers.
* Tuned into web security (you can explain XSRF and SQL injection).

  


**Location**  

  

This position will be hybrid with 3 days/week in our Oakville, ON office.

 **What It's Like to Work at Euna Solutions**

  


At Euna Solutions, we carefully foster a work environment where employees have a safe space for creative and intellectual freedom, and the opportunity to work cross\\-functionally. We offer a dynamic environment with considerable opportunity for professional growth and advancement.

  



Here are some of the perks that Euna employees enjoy:



 Competitive wages  

We pay competitive wages and salaries, and we only expect an honest 40\\-hour week for it.


* ️ Wellness days


What’s better than a long weekend? An extra\\-long weekend! Euna Employees enjoy 2 extra days off in the summer to extend long weekends! Extra days to decompress and spend time doing the things you love.  


 Community Engagement Committee  

At Euna, we know how important it is to give back. Our community engagement committee looks for ways to give back to our local communities through time, gifts and skills.



Flexible workday  

We understand that what a workday looks like differs by employee and the role requirements. Through our interview process we’ll work with you to ensure it’s a fit for you and the specific role you’re interested in.



 Benefits  

Ask us for a copy of our health and dental benefits!



 Culture committee  

Celebrate at every occasion with the culture team! They make sure that our team’s culture is bustling with frequent fun events for holidays and special occasions, as well as for miscellaneous fun.

  

**About Euna Solutions**

  

Euna Solutions® is a leading provider of purpose\\-built, cloud\\-based solutions that power critical administrative functions and financial operations for the public sector. Euna Solutions offers trusted, easy\\-to\\-use solutions for procurement, payments, grant management, budgeting, permitting, and special education administration that are trusted to increase operational efficiency, transparency, collaboration, and compliance. Working with more than 3,000 government and public sector organizations across North America, Euna Solutions strives to build trust and enable transparency in our communities. Euna Solutions is recognized on Government Technology’s GovTech 100 list, an annual list of the top 100 companies focused on, making a difference in and selling to state and local government agencies across the U.S. To learn more, visit www.eunasolutions.com.

  



Please visit our website: https://eunasolutions.com/careers/ and check out our LinkedIn Pages https://www.linkedin.com/company/eunasolutions/

  

We believe in embracing new perspectives and optimizing impact. If you have relatable experience and relevant transferrable skills but feel you may be missing a few of the requirements, we encourage you to apply! We recognize that people have unique career journeys and if you're excited about this role and know you can bring something great to the team, then we want to hear from you. Please know Euna Solutions is committed to providing a comfortable and accessible interview process for every candidate. If there are any accommodations our team can make throughout our hiring process (big or small), please let us know.

  

  

*For any inquiries or requests regarding accessibility at Euna Solutions, please email* *recruiting@eunasolutions.com* *or call our office at 1\\.877\\.707\\.7755\\. Upon request, appropriate accessible formats or arrangements will be provided as soon as practicable.*

title: AZ Driver
description:
**Position Title:** AZ Driver


**Division:**Da\\-Lee Dust Control


**Location:** Stoney Creek, ON, Various – Cross\\-border (Winter Season), Inter\\-Provincial Travel


**Employment Type:** Full\\-time


**Salary:** $27\\.00 per hour

 **Company Overview**



This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of Da\\-Lee Group, a family\\-owned company with over 50 years of industry leadership. Our headquarters are in Stoney Creek, Ontario. We specialize in premium products and services, including dust control, winter de\\-icing, pavement repair, and waste management, all driven by a commitment to excellence, sustainability, and operational efficiency. We currently have 9 different locations and we are growing.

  




We are proud to have recently earned the Great Place To Work® certification, highlighting our dedication to fostering a supportive and inclusive workplace. At Da\\-Lee, we prioritize employee growth through advanced learning and development software, empowering our team to excel and achieve their career goals.

  



Following a recapitalization with Alphi Capital, Da\\-Lee Group is poised for continued growth in dust control services and environmental solutions. If you’re a motivated professional seeking a dynamic career in an organization that values innovation and employee success, we encourage you to apply!

 **Position Summary**

As an AZ\\-licensed driver, your primary role is operating specialized trucks for dust control and de\\-icing services. Your live load and cross\\-border operations expertise ensure efficient and reliable service delivery.  



  

**Responsibilities**


* Operate trucks (mainly automatic; truck and pup experience is an asset) for hauling and delivery operations for dust control services in the summer and de\\-icing services in the winter.
* Conduct daily vehicle circle checks and receive paperwork before beginning runs.
* Drive across Ontario, with occasional cross\\-border travel to the U.S. (2–3 months/year in winter) and inter\\-provincial travel to Nova Scotia or Montreal (\\~10%).
* Flexibility for occasional overnight shifts (up to 3 nights/year) based on client needs.
* Perform shop duties on rain days, including cleaning trucks or other operational support tasks to maintain full\\-time hours.
* Maintain excellent customer service standards, using sound judgment when adapting to job site conditions (e.g., determining appropriate gravel use).
* Ensure safe delivery practices and compliance with environmental regulations (e.g., avoiding spills).
* Collaborate with team members to complete jobs safely, efficiently, and professionally.


**Qualifications \\& Specifications**


* Valid AZ license with a clean driver’s abstract and CVOR.
* Experience with tanker trucks is preferred.
* Truck and pup experience is considered an asset.
* Willingness to undergo cross\\-border drug testing.
* Must be customer\\-service oriented and capable of making real\\-time judgment calls on\\-site.
* Comfortable working independently and communicating with clients on job details and changes.
* Cross\\-border and inter\\-provincial travel readiness (including valid passport or eligibility).


**Working Conditions and Physical Requirements**


* Typical shift runs from 6:30 AM – 5:00 PM; off\\-season hours may shift to 7:00 AM – 4:00 PM.
* Minimum 40 hours per week, with guaranteed shop work on weather\\-impacted days.
* Must be able to pull hoses and lift up to 50 lbs.
* Subject to a May–June blackout period (no time off during peak season).


**Environment and Benefits**

title: Elementary English and Math Teacher/Tutor
description:

Passionate about puns? Excited by equations? Eager to help students succeed in English and Math?



Gain valuable teaching experience! **Oxford Learning Richmond Hill South** is currently seeking part\\-time teacher\\-tutors for a role in our learning centre. This position is perfect for anyone who loves working with students, enjoys teaching the ins and outs of language, and is passionate about helping others build their skills in this area.



Teacher\\-Tutors at Oxford Learning **do not** have to lesson plan before class, as all lessons are pre\\-planned. Applicants will be fully trained in our proprietary philosophy and methods.


**Position Requirements:**



All Teacher\\-Tutors at Oxford Learning work during after\\-school and evening hours (4:00pm \\- 8:00pm) as well as Saturdays (9:00am \\- 3:00pm). A commitment until the end of the term in June is preferred. Continuing through the summer is even better. Your students will love working with you, and being reliable is a must.



This role is in\\-person. You must be able to commute to this location. This is not an online position. Vulnerable sector screening is mandatory.



We encourage you to apply if you have the majority of the following requirements:


**Education**:


* Bachelor’s degree or similar certification in a relevant field
* Fourth year university students with extensive tutoring experience will be considered
* Teaching certification an asset
* Good knowledge of the current Kindergarten to Grade 9 curriculum


**Experience**:


* Some experience teaching/tutoring at a Kindergarten to Grade 9 (or equivalent) level

* Ability to multitask and balance working with up to three students at a time


**Responsibilities (Position Details)**



You will work directly with students as an Interactive Coach with the following responsibilities:


* Teaching up to 3 students at a time at different levels
* Teaching online and in\\-person
* Following the Oxford Learning methodologies and philosophies
* Filling in post\\-lesson notes
* Completing daily student communication updates
* Maintaining a friendly and professional manner at all times


**Smiles, High\\-Fives \\& Happy Students**



In this position, you will play a key role in helping students develop their self\\-confidence and self\\-esteem. The rewards of helping children overcome academic hurdles and realize their inner potential can be very fulfilling. You will be rewarded with smiling faces and high\\-fives during every shift. Other rewards of the role include:


* fun staff events
* ongoing training opportunities
* frequent check\\-ins and feedback
* company growth opportunities
* hands\\-on development of your teaching skills


**Job Type**: Part\\-time


**Schedule:**


* Evenings
* Monday to Friday
* Saturday availability


**About Oxford Learning**



Oxford Learning is a Canadian supplemental education provider helping students get better grades since 1984\\. Offering a full range of programs for students of all ages and abilities, Oxford Learning uses the science of cognitive learning to help all students develop stronger learning skills they can rely on for life!


**Are you the superstar teacher\\-tutor we have been searching for? Apply now!**



Oxford Learning Richmond Hill South



9011 Leslie St., Unit 12, Richmond Hill, ON



Tel: (905\\) 709\\-4545


**We thank all applicants for their interest in joining the team at Oxford Learning Richmond Hill South. However, only those selected for the interview process will be contacted.**
